THPO WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH TRIBAL RANGERS ON MEASURES TOPROTECT AND PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCES AND ARCHEOLOGICAL SITES ON THE RESERVATION. THPO WILL RESEARCH NEWTECHNIQUES AND TECHNOLOGY THAT CAN BE USED TO PROTECT CULTURAL RESOURCES. THE GOAL IS EXAMINE TECHNIQUES USED BYTHE BLM OR FISH AND WILDLIFE. THE OBJECTIVE IS TO RESEARCH NEW TECHNOLOGY TO PROTECT VARIOUS SITES. THPO REPORTON PROGRESS IN MONTHLY REPORTS. REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE: THPO WILL CONSULT WITH FEDERAL, STATE, COUNTY AND TRIBALAGENCIES ON UNDERTAKINGS THAT MAY ADVERSELY IMPACT PLPT HISTORIC PROPERTIES ON THE RESERVATION AND IN ANCESTRALTERRITORIES. THPO WILL ACTIVELY MONITOR REGULATORY CHANGES TO HISTORIC PRESERVATION LAWS, BOTH PROPOSED ANDIMPLEMENTED. WHEN NECESSARY THPO WILL ENGAGE IN MOUS OR MOAS WITH FEDERAL AGENCIES WHO DEVELOPUNDERTAKINGS ON FEDERAL LANDS. THE GOAL OF THIS CATEGORY IS TO CONTINUE WITH THE CONSULTATION PROCESS. THEOBJECTIVE IS TO VOICE CONCERNS AND ENGAGE IN MITIGATION MEASURES TO PREVENT IMPACTS TO CULTURAL RESOURCES ONFEDERAL LANDS.NATIONAL REGISTER: THPO ROUTINELY SEARCHES THE ARCHEOLOGICAL RECORD TO DETERMINE IF CERTAIN SITES ARE ELIGIBLEFOR INCLUSION.EDUCATION: THPO WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION BOOTHS AT TRIBALLY SPONSORED EVENTS, WORK WITHVARIOUS DEPARTMENTS ON PROJECTS. THE GOAL IS TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON THPO ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOTCONFIDENTIAL. THE OBJECTIVE IS TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF HISTORY.

SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO SUBMITS THIS APPLICATION FOR THE FY2022 - HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND- ANNUAL TRIBAL HISTORICPRESERVATION OFFICE GRANT (P22AS00642). IN RESPONSE TO ONGOING DISTURBANCE AND VULNERABILITY OF SANTO DOMINGOPUEBLO TRIBAL CULTURAL RESOURCES AND A HOST OF URGENT HEALTH AND SAFETY-RELATED COMMUNITY INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTSNECESSITATING CULTURAL RESOURCE REVIEW COMPLIANCE, THE SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO TRIBAL COUNCIL IN 2021 ADOPTEDRESOLUTION NO. 04-2021-14 ESTABLISHING THE SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO). THESANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO THPO HAS FORMALLY ASSUMED FUNCTIONS OF THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER (SHPO) ONSANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO TRIBAL LANDS THROUGH ITS MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT PURSUANT TO THE NATIONAL HISTORICPRESERVATION ACT (NHPA) WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE. THE PUEBLO NOW SEEKS TO USE THE HISTORIC PRESERVATIONFUND- ANNUAL TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE GRANT TO FULLY COVER THE THPO SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS ANDPARTIALLY COVER THE ASSISTANT THPO SALARY AND FRINGE BENEFITS AS THEY ARE THE SOLE STAFF RESPONSIBLE FOR CARRYINGOUT ALL OBJECTIVES AND ACTIVITIES WITHIN SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO THPO PROGRAM PLAN SUBMITTED TO THE NATIONAL PARKSERVICE. THE THPO AND ASSISTANT THPO WILL CARRY OUT RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACTIVITIES UNDER THE HISTORICPRESERVATION FUND PROGRAM AREAS INCLUDING ADMINISTRATION, PLANNING, SURVEY AND INVENTORY, REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE,AND AN OPTIONAL PROGRAM AREA. THE ENTIRETY OF THE SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO COMMUNITY INCLUDING FORTHCOMINGGENERATIONS OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS ARE EXPECTED TO BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT.

IN THE PAST YEAR, AN ORDINANCE PUT TOGETHER BY THE TRIBE'S THPO DEPARTMENT AND NATURAL RESOURCE DEPARTMENT WASPASSED BY THE TRIBAL COUNCIL AND IS IN EFFECT. IT OUTLINES A PRESERVATION PLAN FOR GROUND-DISTURBING DEVELOPMENTSON LAND OWNED BY, OR UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF THE TRIBE. THIS PLAN COVERS HISTORIC, ARCHAEOLOGICAL, ANDTRADITIONAL CULTURAL PROPERTIES, ALONG WITH ANY POTENTIAL NATURAL RESOURCES THAT MAY BE THREATENED BY FUTUREDEVELOPMENT PLANS.THE TRIBE'S THPO DEPARTMENT WILL CONTINUE TO COOPERATE WITH THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, THE ADVISORY COUNCILON HISTORIC PRESERVATION, AND OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATE AGENCIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, ORGANIZATIONS, ANDINDIVIDUALS TO ENSURE THAT HISTORIC PROPERTIES ARE TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION AT ALL LEVELS OF PLANNING ANDDEVELOPMENT, AS OUTLINED IN THE TRIBE'S MOA.

THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER AND THE CULTURAL PRESERVATION BOARD WILL ASSUME THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE OVERALL ADMINISTRATION OF THE SISSETON WAHPETON OYATE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE PURSUANT TO FEDERAL, STATE AND TRIBAL LAW.THE FY 2022 HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUNDING PROVIDED THROUGH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE IS, UNFORTUNATELY, NOT SUFFICIENT IN CARRYING OUT EVEN A FRACTION OF THE RESPONSIBILITIES OUTLINED IN THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE SISSETON WAHPETON OYATE AND THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE. ALTHOUGH THE ALLOCATION FOR THE 2021 FISCAL YEAR PROVIDED US THE ABILITY TO PROVIDE MORE SERVICES THROUGH THE RESPONSIBILITIES OUR OFFICE HAS ASSUMED, IT IS STILL NOT ADEQUATE TO EFFECTIVELY ADMINISTER TO THE NEEDS OF OUR TRIBE, AS WELL AS REQUESTS FOR SECTION 106 COMPLIANCE. THE FUNDS ARE HELPFUL IN ASSISTING THE TRIBE IN PROVIDING NEEDED SERVICES AND FULFILLING OUR GRANT REQUIREMENTS.

THE SEMINOLE TRIBE OF FLORIDA TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (STOF THPO) WILL UTILIZE THE FY 2022 GRANTFUNDING FROM THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND (HPF) IN ORDER TO CARRY OUT THE THPO ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATIONSACTIVITIES ON TRIBAL LANDS. THE OPERATIONS OF THE OFFICE SUPPORTS THE MISSION AND VISION OF THE THPO. THE MISSIONOF OUR THPO IS TO CHAMPION TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY THROUGH PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF SEMINOLE CULTURAL INTERESTS.THE VISION IS TO EMPOWER THE SEMINOLE PEOPLE. THE PROGRAM AREAS IN THE GRANT ARE TAKEN FROM THE HISTORICPRESERVATION FUND MANUAL AND REFLECT THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER (THPO) RESPONSIBILITIES (INITALICS) AS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 101 (B)(3) OF THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT (NHPA) AND ASSUMED BY THETRIBE PURSUANT TO SECTION 101 (D)(2) OF THE NHPA.THE GRANT HELPS ONE OF OUR OBJECTIVES FOR 2022 INCLUDES TO CONTINUE TO CONDUCT, RECORD, EVALUATE AND INTERPRETALL ARCHAEOLOGICAL SURVEYS FOR TRIBAL PROJECTS UNDER THE STOF CULTURAL RESOURCE ORDINANCE (C-01-16). ONE AREA,THE TRIBAL ARCHAEOLOGY SECTION, WILL CONTINUE TO ASSIST IN CREATING THE RESEARCH DESIGN THAT INCLUDES: DEFINITIONOF A PROBLEM, SUBJECT, OR HYPOTHESIS FOR INVESTIGATION; THE BACKGROUND AND CONTEXT TO THE INVESTIGATION; THEPROPOSED MEANS AND METHODS OF THE INVESTIGATION; THE WORK PLAN AND TIMETABLE; DETAILS OF THE PROPOSEDINVESTIGATIONS, MANAGEMENT ARRANGEMENTS, AND QUALITY CONTROL. THIS WORK HELPS THE PROGRESS OF TRIBAL DEVELOPMENTFOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY.THE THPO STAFF WILL PARTICIPATE IN VARIOUS TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND ENGAGEMENTWITH OUTSIDE INSTITUTIONS TO PROMOTE HISTORIC PRESERVATION. THE THPO WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION, EDUCATION, ANDTECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY. TRAVEL FOR STAFF TO ATTEND THE NATIONAL CONGRESS OF AMERICANINDIANS (NCAI) ANNUAL CONVENTION TO MAINTAIN AND ENCOURAGE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF STAFF WITHIN THE FIELD OFHISTORIC PRESERVATION AND EXPAND UNDERSTANDING OF TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY. THE STAFF WILL ENGAGE WITH PEERS ANDCOLLEAGUES FROM ACROSS OTHER TRIBES ON TOPICS SUCH AS HOW TO IMPROVE COMPLIANCE CONSULTATIONS WITH FEDERALAGENCIES AND OUTSIDE INSTITUTIONS, PROTECTION OF CULTURAL AND BURIAL RESOURCES, AND ENGAGE ON CURRENT ISSUES ININDIAN COUNTRY. THIS WILL ALSO ALLOW STAFF TO UPDATE AND PREPARE THE THPO OPERATIONS HEADING INTO THE NEW FISCALAND STRATEGIC PLANNING YEAR.

AS DESCRIBED IN THE PUEBLO OF SAN FELIPE THPO PLAN: "THE HISTORIC PLANNING PROCESS ON THE PUEBLO IS AND WILLCONTINUE TO BE A RATIONAL, SYSTEMATIC PROCESS BY WHICH THE PUEBLO MAINTAINS ITS VISION, GOALS, AND PRIORITIES FORTHE PRESERVATION OF ITS HISTORIC AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. THE PUEBLO WILL CONTINUE TO ACHIEVE ITS VISION THROUGHITS OWN ACTIONS AND THROUGH INFLUENCING THE ACTIONS OF OTHERS. GOALS AND PRIORITIES CONTINUE TO BE THOSE HELD BYTHE PUEBLO SINCE TIME IMMEMORIAL AND ARE CENTERED ON THE LAND, NATURAL RESOURCES, LANGUAGE, CULTURAL ANDRELIGIOUS PRACTICES." (PLAN P. 16)AS THE THPO OFFICE CONTINUES TO DEVELOP, TIME, EFFORT AND COMMUNICATION IS REQUIRED TO COOPERATE WITH THESECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, THE ADVISORY COUNCIL ON HISTORIC PRESERVATION, TRIBAL, FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES,LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS TO ENSURE THAT HISTORIC PROPERTIES ARE TAKEN INTOCONSIDERATION AT ALL LEVELS OF PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT AS DESCRIBED IN THE PLAN PAGE18.THE PUEBLO OF SAN FELIPE RECEIVED ITS THPO DESIGNATION IN JUNE OF 2016. TO ENSURE THE HISTORIC PLANNING PROCESSON THE PUEBLO IS FORMALIZED, TIME AND FUNDING WILL BE DEDICATED TO CONTINUING THE FUNCTIONING AND ESTABLISHMENTOF OUR THPO OFFICE. GOALS AND DELIVERABLES UNDER THIS WORKPLAN WILL INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO EXPAND UPON ANDSOLIDIFY THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE THPO OFFICE, AND TO ENGAGING IN EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION WITH INTERNALAND EXTERNAL AGENCIES, INCLUDING THE NM SHPO. TRAININGS AND MEETINGS AS AVAILABLE MUST BE ATTENDED BY THE THPOTO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE OF HISTORIC PRESERVATION LAW AND PRACTICE IN ORDER TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE SAN FELIPETHPO.

ADMINISTRATIONTHE ACOMA TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (ATHPO) WAS ESTABLISHED BY TRIBAL RESOLUTION IN OCTOBER OF 1999 TOPRESERVE ACOMA'S CULTURAL IDENTITY. THE ATHPO, THROUGH ITS TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER (THPO),ADMINISTERS THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE THPO GRANT. THE THPO CONTINUES TO ADMINISTER EIGHT (8) OF THE TEN(10) FUNCTIONS AS ASSUMED BY THE NEW MEXICO STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE. TO DEVELOP OUR HISTORICPRESERVATION PROGRAM AND DEVELOP THE RESOURCES NEEDED FOR ADEQUATE PLANNING, REVIEW, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE,THE ATHPO IS PROPOSING TO UTILIZE GRANT FUNDING TO ADDRESS CRITICAL PROGRAMMATIC NEEDS IN THE AREAS OF PLANNING,SURVEY AND INVENTORY, REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE, AND EDUCATION, AS CITED IN THE GOALS OF THE PRESERVATION PLAN.PLANNINGDEVELOPMENT OF THPO PLANNING, PROTOCOLS, AND PROCESSGOAL 2, OBJECTIVE 1ACTIVITY:1. REVIEW AND ASSESSMENT OF ALL EXISTING ATHPO PLANNING, PROTOCOLS, AND PROCEDURES TO DATE. THIS WORK WILLINCLUDE COLLABORATIVE DISCUSSIONS WITH ACOMA DEPARTMENTS TO UNDERSTAND WHERE CLARITY OF THE ATHPO PERMITTING,REVIEW, AND CLEARANCE PROCESS IS LACKING AND DEVELOP CLEAR PROCEDURES TO ADDRESS THE NEED.2. ATHPO WILL DEVELOP A PROCESS AND STRUCTURE FOR ACOMA COMMUNITY MEMBERS REQUESTING HOME SITE CLEARANCES.THIS PROCESS WILL INVOLVE INPUT FROM TRIBAL ADMINISTRATION AND THE BOARD.3. ATHPO SHALL DEVELOP CLEAR PROCEDURES FOR THE COLLECTION OF ALL CULTURAL RESOURCE DATA TO BE UPLOADED INTOTHE NEW GIS DATABASE.4. ATHPO WILL REVIEW AND DEVELOP PROTOCOLS FOR ADDRESSING THE DISCOVERY OF HUMAN REMAINS ON TRIBAL LANDSDURING DEVELOPMENT, A PROCESS TO ADDRESS REPATRIATIONS OUTSIDE OF NAGPRA, AND DISPOSITION PROTOCOLS.5. REVIEW OF PAST 5-YEAR PLAN TO DEVELOP AND PREPARE A NEW 5-YEAR PLAN THROUGH A SERIES OF PLANNING MEETINGSWITH INPUT FROM BOARD, TRIBAL ADMINISTRATION, AND DIRECTOR.DEVELOPMENT OF A TRIBAL MONITORING PROGRAM AND PILOT PROJECTGOAL 2, OBJECTIVE 2; GOAL 3, OBJECTIVE 4ACTIVITY:1. ATHPO WILL WORK WITH AN IDENTIFIED CONSULTANT TO PLAN AND DEVELOP A TRIBAL MONITORING PROGRAM PLAN WITHSPECIFIC COMPONENTS TO ADDRESS CULTURAL, ARCHAEOLOGICAL, GEOLOGIC, AND PLANT RESOURCE IDENTIFICATION, RECORDING,AND PRESERVATION.2. ATHPO WILL PILOT A 4-WEEK PROGRAM, INCLUSIVE OF A TWO-WEEK TRAINING PROGRAM, WITH (5) ACOMA COMMUNITYMEMBERS. POST-PROGRAM ATHPO WILL RECEIVE FEEDBACK, REVIEW AND ASSESS PILOT PROJECT AND MAKE ANY ADJUSTMENT TO THE PROGRAM AS NECESSARY. THIS PILOT PROJECT WILL SERVE AS THE BASIS FOR A MORE FORMALIZED PROGRAM SUITABLE FORLARGER GRANT FUNDING AND PERMANENT INCLUSION BY THE ATHPO AS A STANDARD OFFERING.SURVEY AND INVENTORYEVALUATION, IDENTIFICATION, AND SURVEY OF PROPOSED ACOMA DEVELOPMENT CORRIDORSGOAL 1, OBJECTIVES 1, 3, AND 6ACTIVITY:1. ATHPO SHALL WORKING WITH TRIBAL ADMINISTRATION AND TRIBAL PROGRAMS TO IDENTIFY LOCATIONS OF HIGHFORESEEABLE DEVELOPMENT. THESE AREAS WILL BE PRIORITIZED BASED ON CRITERIA IMPORTANT TO ACOMA AND IDENTIFIED ONTRIBAL LAND MAPS FOR SURVEY.2. ATHPO WILL WORK WITH CULTURAL EXPERTS AND CONTRACT ARCHEOLOGIST TO SURVEY, IDENTIFY, AND RECORD KNOWNARCHAEOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL SITES INCLUDING TRADITIONAL CULTURAL PROPERTIES AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES TO BEINCLUDED INTO THE GIS DATABASE AND IDENTIFIED ON MAPS FOR PLANNING PURPOSES.3. THPO WILL REVIEW THE PROPOSED DEVELOPMENT CORRIDORS WITH TRIBAL ADMINISTRATION AND TRIBAL PROGRAMS ASINFORMATION BECOMES AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW AND FEEDBACK.4. ATHPO WILL DEVELOP A GIS TECHNICIAN POSITION TO ADDRESS THE DATA MANAGEMENT NEEDS OF THE PROGRAM.DEVELOPMENT OF CULTURAL LANDSCAPE MAPS WITH EMPHASIS ON PROPOSED ACOMA DEVELOPMENT CORRIDORSGOAL 1, OBJECTIVE 1 AND 3ACTIVITY:1. THE ATHPO WILL UTILIZE OUR GIS SYSTEM TO PRODUCE CULTURAL RESOURCE MAPS TO BE UTILIZED BY OUR TRIBALDEPARTMENT.

SURVEY AND INVENTORY- NO MAJOR ACTIVITIES PLANNEDREVIEW AND COMPLIANCE - CONTINUE ROUTINE REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIESNATIONAL REGISTER - NO MAJOR ACTIVITIES PLANNEDDEVELOPMENT/ACQUISITION/COVENANTS - NO MAJOR ACTIVITIES PLANNEDTAX CREDITS - NO MAJOR ACTIVITIES PLANNEDLOCAL GOVERNMENT CERTIFICATION - NO MAJOR ACTIVITIES PLANNED

THROUGHOUT INDIAN COUNTRY, NATIVE LANDS CONTAIN A WIDE RANGE OF ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESOURCES HISTORIC SITES ANDTRADITIONAL GATHERING PLACES THAT ARE HIGHLY VALUED BY TRIBAL PEOPLE. THE PRIMARY MISSION OF THE TRIBAL HISTORICPRESERVATION OFFICER IS TO IDENTIFY, PRESERVE AND PROTECT OUR NATIVE CULTURAL HERITAGE AS WELL AS TO INCREASEKNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS OF THE SIGNIFICANCE AND MEANING OF CULTURAL SITES AND HISTORIC PROPERTIES FOR FUTUREGENERATIONS OF OUR TRIBE. THE SPOKANE TRIBE OF INDIANS, TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE IS ENGAGED INCONSULTATION WITH FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, TO PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE TRIBE'S CULTURAL ITEMS ONFEDERAL, AND STATE LANDS, AND WITHIN MUSEUMS TO BE BROUGHT BACK TO THE SPOKANE TRIBE. TRIBAL THPO IS CONTINUOUSLYCONSULTING WITH FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL AND PRIVATE AGENCIES REGARDING NEARLY 1,000 CASELOADS. WHEN CONSULTINGWITH THESE AGENCIES ON A CASE, IT TAKES NUMEROUS LETTERS AND ON-SITE VISITS, BEFORE COMPLETING ANY ONE PROJECT.FINALLY, STOI PLANS ONLY "ROUTINE REVIEWS AND COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES".

LTBB'S TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO) ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES LISTED BELOW DIRECTLY RELATE TO THELITTLE TRAVERSE BAY BANDS OF ODAWA INDIANS' (LTBB) THPO PROGRAM PLAN'S GOALS AND OBJECTIVES. LTBB'S PROGRAM PLANOBJECTIVES ARE AS FOLLOWS:A. IN COOPERATION WITH FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS ANDINDIVIDUALS, DIRECT AND CONDUCT A COMPREHENSIVE SURVEY OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES ON TRIBAL TRUST LAND, AND MAINTAININVENTORIES OF SUCH PROPERTIES;B. IDENTIFY AND NOMINATE ELIGIBLE PROPERTIES TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER AND OTHERWISE ADMINISTER APPLICATIONSFOR LISTING HISTORIC PROPERTIES ON THE NATIONAL REGISTER;C. PREPARE AND IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION PLAN;D. ADMINISTER FEDERAL ASSISTANCE RECEIVED BY THE LTBB THPO FOR HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES IMPLEMENTEDON THEIR TRIBAL TRUST LAND;E. ADVISE AND ASSIST, AS APPROPRIATE, FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, IN CARRYING OUTTHEIR HISTORIC PRESERVATION RESPONSIBILITIES;F. PROVIDE PUBLIC INFORMATION, EDUCATION AND TRAINING, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON HISTORIC PRESERVATION.H. CONSULT WITH THE APPROPRIATE FEDERAL AGENCIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THIS ACT ON -A. FEDERAL UNDERTAKINGS THAT MAY AFFECT HISTORIC PROPERTIES; ANDB. THE CONTENT AND SUFFICIENCY OF ANY PLANS DEVELOPED TO PROTECT, MANAGE, OR TO REDUCE OR MITIGATE HARM TOSUCH PROPERTIES;THESE OBJECTIVES ARE INTEGRATED WITHIN THE FOLLOWING ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES LIST. GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF LLBO THPO PROPOSED PROJECT:THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (LLBO THPO) ARE TOIDENTIFY, EVALUATE, AND PROTECT HISTORIC PROPERTIES. LLBO THPO WILL ADDRESS THIS GOAL THROUGH SURVEYS, PLANNING,TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, DEVELOPMENT, EDUCATION, AND ASSISTING THE LLBO GOVERNMENT IN CARRYING OUT THE HISTORICPRESERVATION ACTIVITIES THAT THE TRIBE AGREED TO ASSUME FROM THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE, ON TRIBALLANDS, UNDER THEIR PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT ACTIVITIES:1. ADMINISTRATION: ADMINISTRATION ACTIVITIES CARRIED OUT BY LLBO THPO.2. PLANNING: LLBO THPO WILL CONTINUE TO MEET WITH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PARTNERS REGARDING ACTIONS, EVENTS, ANDISSUES RELATING TO CULTURAL AND HISTORIC RESOURCES.3. SURVEY AND INVENTORY: MONITOR PROGRESS AND CONSULT ON ARCHAEOLOGICAL SURVEYS WITHIN EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES ANDHISTORIC TRIBAL AREAS.4. REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE: CONTINUE REVIEWING AND MONITORING LAND CLAIM AREAS WITHIN AND OUTSIDE OF THE EXTERIORRESERVATION BOUNDARIES. LLBO THPO WILL ROUTINELY CHECK COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES.5. EDUCATION: LLBO THPO WILL CONTINUE TO OFFER EDUCATIONAL PRESENTATIONS AND TRAINING TO LOCAL, STATE, ANDNATIONAL PARTNERS.PERFORMANCE GOALS, MILESTONES, AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:1. SURVEY AND INVENTORY 6,000 ACRES AND 15 SITES WITHIN TRIBAL LANDS.2. CONTINUE TO WORK WITH EXTERNAL PARTNERS SUCH AS THE INDIAN ADVISORY COMMITTEE LED BY THE MINNESOTA HISTORICALSOCIETY AND NATHPO TO INCREASE OUR LLBO TRIBAL REPRESENTATION.3. HOLD ANNUAL YOUTH ARCHEOLOGY TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL DAYS TO INCREASE YOUTH INTEREST AND EDUCATION IN THESTUDY OF ARCHEOLOGY.4. PRESENT EDUCATIONAL PRESENTATIONS AT LOCAL COLLEGES TO PROMOTE THE IMPORTANCE OF TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATIONPRACTICES TO EDUCATORS AND STUDENTS.WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT?TRIBAL MEMBERS, COMMUNITY MEMBERS, YOUTH, THE LLBO GOVERNMENT AND PROGRAMS, AND REGIONAL, STATE, AND NATIONALPARTNERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT. LLBO THPO IS ESSENTIAL TO PRESERVING AND PROTECTING LEECH LAKE'STRADITIONAL CULTURAL PROPERTIES.

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY:FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P22ASOO642GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF PROPOSED PROJECT:(ADMINISTRATION) GOAL 1: HAVE CURRENT THPO DIRECTOR CONTINUE GRANTS MANAGEMENT AND TRAINING TO ENSURECONTINUANCE OF THE PROGRAM.OBJECTIVE 1: SEND THE THPO DIRECTOR TO NPS APPROVED GRANTS MANAGEMENT TRAINING FOR CERTIFICATION TO ENSURE HEMEETS THE NECESSARY CRITERIA TO OVERSEE THE GRANT.(SURVEY AND INVENTORY) GOAL 1: COLLECT DATA ABOUT LOCATIONS OF CULTURAL RESOURCES AND ENTER INTO THE GIS TOSTORE AND PRESENT GEOGRAPHICAL DATA FOR A RESERVATION WIDE SURVEY AND CULTURAL RESOURCES INVENTORY.OBJECTIVE 1: CONTINUE TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE LIST OF TRADITIONAL CULTURAL PROPERTIES, ARCHAEOLOGICALPROPERTIES, AS WELL AS HISTORIC PROPERTIES LOCATED WITHIN THE KBIC'S RESERVATION BOUNDARIES, TREATY CEDEDTERRITORY, AND HISTORIC HOMELANDS OF THE OJIBWE.GOAL 2: CONTINUE THE DOCUMENTATION ON ORAL TRADITIONS OF THE KBIC OJIBWE.OBJECTIVE 1: IN ORDER TO COMPILE THE MOST ACCURATE MATERIAL IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES INVENTORY, ORAL INTERVIEWSHAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS A PRIORITY AMONGST THE COMMUNITY. TRIBAL ELDERS AND FAMILIES CAN, THROUGH ORALINTERVIEWS, IDENTIFY AREAS THAT OTHERWISE MAY NOT HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED. WITH THIS INFORMATION, THE THPO CANPROVIDE PROTECTION FROM THE DESTRUCTION OR DEVELOPMENT OF THESE AREAS. THERE ARE VERY FEW ELDERS LEFT WITHIN THECOMMUNITY THAT REMEMBER OUR TRADITIONAL WAYS AND PLACES OF CULTURAL SIGNIFICANCE. THE THPO WILL CONTINUE TOINTERVIEW TRIBAL ELDERS LIVING WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, AS WELL AS THOSE WHO HAVE LEFT THE COMMUNITY. THIS WILL BEACHIEVED THROUGH EITHER INDIVIDUAL OR GROUP INTERVIEWS. DATA COLLECTED FROM THESE INTERVIEWS WILL BE DIGITIZEDAND STORED IN TWO DIFFERENT TRIBAL BUILDINGS. THIS 2022 WORK PLAN/BUDGET JUSTIFICATION IS THE JICARILLA APACHE NATION'S APPLICATION FORASSISTANCE UNDER THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND (HPF), ADMINISTERED BY THE NPS. IT WILLSUPPORT CONTINUED OPERATIONS OF THE JICARILLA APACHE NATION'S TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATIONOFFICE (JAN THPO) FOR THE FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2022.

THE HOPLAND BAND OF POMO INDIANS ARE A TRIBE INDIGENOUS TO WHAT IS NOW SOUTHERN MENDOCINO COUNTY IN NORTHERNCALIFORNIA. THE HOPLAND TRIBE'S THPO PROGRAM IS A PROJECT THAT WILL BENEFIT THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY BOTH ON AND OFFTHE HOPLAND RESERVATION. THIS PROJECT, WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND THE HISTORICPRESERVATION FUND, IS THOUGHTFULLY DESIGNED TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE HBPI IN REGARD TO MEANINGFULLYIMPLEMENTATION OF THE SECTION 106 REVIEW PROCESS TO CONSIDER THE EFFECTS ON HISTORIC PROPERTIES ON AND OFF THERESERVATION AND NEARBY PERTINENT SITES. THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER WILL BE PERFORMING ALL THOSENECESSARY DUTIES OF THE POSITION FOR THE TRIBE. THIS INCLUDES THE PERPETUAL CONTINUATION OF ABOVE-MENTIONEDSECTION 106 SITE REVIEWS IN THE EVALUATION OF CULTURAL AND HISTORIC LAND PRESERVATION ON OUR LOCAL REGIONAL LEVELWHEN REQUESTED. THPO ALSO SEEKS TO ACQUIRE CERTAIN NATIONAL REGISTER ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS WHILE POTENTIALLYENTERING INTO CO-MANAGEMENT AGREEMENTS WITH LANDOWNERS AND STATE AND FEDERAL ENTITIES TO PROTECT EXISTING ANDFUTURE LANDMARKS. THE REMAINING PROJECT DUTIES ARE TO PLAN, IMPLEMENT AND EXECUTE A SERIES OF CULTURALLY RELEVANTACTIVITIES TO ENRICH AND EDUCATE OUR TARGET TRIBAL POPULATION AS WELL AS INTERESTED STUDENTS AND PROFESSIONALSALIKE SO THEY MAY MAINTAIN AND INNOVATE OUR CURRENT HOPLAND CULTURE BASE FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS TO FIND MEANINGAND FULFILLMENT. THE HOPLAND BAND OF POMO INDIANS ARE DEDICATED TO PRESERVING AND CULTIVATING OUR EXISTINGLIFEWAYS AND THIS PROJECT HAS AND WILL ASSIST IN THE PROMOTING, ENCOURAGING, AND EMPOWERING THE TRIBE'S GOALS FORTHE PEOPLE.

THE PROPOSED FUNDING WILL BE USED TO FURTHER THE HCN THPO ASSUMPTIONS OF DUTIES, TO INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMIT US TO:1) GOV TO GOV CONSULTATION. 2) CONDUCT PRESERVATION SURVEYS. 3) IMPLEMENT THE NATION'S CULTURAL RESOURCES PLAN.4) ASSIST OTHER AGENCIES TO CARRY OUT THEIR HISTORIC PRESERVATION RESPONSIBILITIES. 5) EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH. 6)CREATE PRESERVATION DOCUMENTS PERTINENT TO THE HO-CHUNK NATION'S NEEDS. 7) ASSIST OTHERS WHO REACH OUT THE HO-CHUNK NATION FOR PRESERVATION ASSISTANCE.TRACKING

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P22AS00642GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF YOUR PROPOSED PROJECT: THE GOAL OF THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND (HPF) TO TRIBALHISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICES (THPO) IS TO PROTECT AND CONSERVE HISTORICALLY AND CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT TRIBALASSETS AND SITES BY PROVIDING FUNDING TO ASSIST TRIBES IN EXECUTING THEIR HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROGRAMS ANDACTIVITIES PURSUANT TO THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT, 54 U.S.C. 300101 ET SEQ., AND OTHER RELEVANT LAWS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT ACTIVITIES:- THE THPO SURVEYS AND MAPS SITES WHICH ARE SLATED FOR DEVELOPMENT WITHIN THE NEXT 3 YEARS.- THE THPO WILL CONTINUE TO OVERSEE ALL SURVEYS AND EXCAVATIONS TO ENSURE THE FEDERAL GUIDELINES, TRIBALTRADITIONS AND PRACTICES HAVE BEEN ADHERED TO AND RECOGNIZED.- TRIBAL SACRED SITES CONTAIN THE TRIBE'S CONFIDENTIAL CULTURAL INFORMATION AND ARE BEING INPUT INTO THETRIBE'S REGISTER.- DIRECT AND CONDUCT A COMPREHENSIVE SURVEY AND MAINTAIN AN INVENTORY OF HISTORIC AND CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANTPROPERTIES ON TRIBAL LANDS.- IDENTIFY AND NOMINATE ELIGIBLE PROPERTIES TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES AND OTHERWISEADMINISTER APPLICATIONS FOR LISTING HISTORIC PROPERTIES ON THE NATIONAL REGISTER.- DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE, HISTORIC PRESERVATION PLAN COVERING HISTORIC, ARCHEOLOGICAL, ANDTRADITIONAL CULTURAL PROPERTIES ON TRIBAL LANDS.- ADMINISTER THE TRIBAL PROGRAM OF FEDERAL ASSISTANCE FOR HISTORIC PRESERVATION WITHIN THE TRIBE.- ADVISE AND ASSIST, AS APPROPRIATE, FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS IN CARRYING OUT THEIRHISTORIC PRESERVATION RESPONSIBILITIES.- ENSURE THAT HISTORIC PROPERTIES ARE TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION AT ALL LEVELS OF PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT.- PROVIDE PUBLIC INFORMATION INCLUDING EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN HISTORICPRESERVATION.- CONSULT WITH THE APPROPRIATE FEDERAL AGENCIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH 54 USC 306108 (COMMONLY KNOWN AS SECTION106 OF THE ACT) ON:- FEDERAL UNDERTAKINGS THAT MAY AFFECT HISTORIC AND CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT PROPERTIES ON TRIBAL LANDS;- THE CONTENT AND SUFFICIENCY OF ANY PLANS TO PROTECT, MANAGE, OR TO REDUCE OR MITIGATE HARM TO SUCHPROPERTIES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: OUR PERFORMANCE GOAL IS TO PROTECT AND CONSERVEHISTORICALLY AND CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT TRIBAL ASSETS AND SITES. OUR MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES WILL BE TORESPOND AND CONSULT ON ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL PROJECTS THAT ARE WITHIN THE HABEMATOLEL POMO OF UPPER LAKESABORIGINAL TERRITORY TO PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE TRIBES CULTURAL RESOURCES.WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM YOUR PROJECT: THE HABEMATOLEL POMO OF UPPER LAKE'S TRIBAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS, ALONG WITHNON-TRIBAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT.

THE PURPOSE OF THE ENTERPRISE RANCHERIA IS TO PROMOTE THE GENERAL WELFARE OF TRIBAL MEMBERS AND THEIRDESCENDANTS, TO EXERCISE CERTAIN RIGHTS OF SELF- GOVERNANCE, TO CONSERVE AND DEVELOP OUR LANDS AND RESOURCES, ANDTO PROMOTE AND SAFEGUARD OUR ABORIGINAL RIGHTS AS ENTERPRISE RANCHERIA PEOPLE. TO THIS END, THE ENTERPRISERANCHERIA WISHES TO ASSUME THE RESPONSIBILITIES FROM THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER (SHPO) TO ESTABLISHA TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER (THPO). SECTION 101 (D)(2) OF THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT (THEACT) ENSURES THAT THE TRIBE'S CULTURAL TRADITIONS AND VALUES ARE PROTECTED AND INCORPORATED INTO THE THPO PROGRAMPLAN AND CARRIED OUT IN THE ENTERPRISE RANCHERIA PEOPLE'S TRIBAL LANDS.TRACKING

WE WILL CONTINUE REPLACING OLD, BROKEN HEADSTONES WITH NEW ONES AND APPLYING FOR ASSISTANCE FROM THE LOCAL ANDNATIONAL LEVELS OF THE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH FOR INFORMATION ABOUT OUR TRIBAL CHURCH. THERE IS STILL WELL OVER 20GRAVES MISSING AND WILL BE SEEKING INFORMATION ON THE MISSING. WE ARE GOING TO REACH OUT TO THE STATE OF SOUTHDAKOTA AND THE STATE HISTORICAL PRESERVATION OFFICE FOR ANY HELP THAT THEY COULD GIVE US.THERE COULD BE AN AMENDMENT TO THE PLAN TO APPLY A SEALANT TO THE BELL TOWER AND THE WOODEN DECK OF THE CHURCH TOBE SURE TO PERSEVERE IT THROUGH THE WINTER.BECAUSE THE CEMETERY IS LOSING AREAS TO USE FOR BURIALS, WE WILL BE MEASURING FAMILY PLOTS TO INCORPORATE THESMALL CREMATION HOUSES OR BIGGER COLUMBARIUM'S AND IN SOME CASES CRISPS TO AVOID SEPARATION OF FAMILY MEMBERBURIALS.NOW THAT COVID-19 RESTRICTIONS ARE SLOWLY LIFTING, WE WILL BE IMPLEMENTING THE GROUND PENETRATING RADAR TO FINDNEW GRAVES AND MARK THEM WITH MONUMENTS. EVENTUALLY WE HOPE TO START TO INCLUDE DNA SAMPLING TO CREATE A TRIBALDATA BANK TO COMPARE UNEARTHED SKELETAL REMAINS TO, BUT THIS WILL BE AN ONGOING PROJECT THAT WILL GO FAR INTO THEFUTURE OF THIS THPO PROGRAM.AS WE DISCONTINUED THE ELDER COMMITTEE, WE WILL REACH OUT TO ONE AT A TIME TO KEEP LEARNING OF OUR HISTORY ANDTEACH THE ELDERS ABOUT THE SECTION 106 PROCESS.

THE TOLOWA DEE-NI' NATION HAS ASSUMED THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE TO REVIEWAND COMMENT ON FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL PROJECTS WITHIN OUR TRIBALLY OWNED LANDS AND ANCESTRAL TERRITORY WHICHMAY HAVE IMPACTS ON CULTURAL RESOURCES. THIS ASSUMPTION OF RESPONSIBILITIES IS OUTLINED IN A MEMORANDUM OFUNDERSTANDING WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION. THE TRIBALHERITAGE PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO) CARRIES OUT CULTURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION ACTIVITIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH MANYLAWS INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT, NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION ACT,AMERICAN INDIAN RELIGIOUS FREEDOM ACT, AND CALIFORNIA ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY ACT. THPO FOCUSES ON THE PROTECTIONOF CULTURAL RESOURCES IN THE LANDSCAPES OF OUR TOLOWA ANCESTRAL TERRITORY.THE FOLLOWING GOALS ARE MET THROUGH PLANNING, SURVEYING, REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES:1) IMPROVE MEANINGFUL PLANNING EFFORTS ON BEHALF OF THE NATION AND IN COLLABORATION/CONSULTATION WITH OTHERSTATE, FEDERAL AND LOCAL AGENCIES.2) CONDUCT SURVEYS OF CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT LOCATIONS3) CONDUCT REVIEW OF PROJECTS AND COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES FOR PROJECTS WITHIN THE NATION'S ANCESTRAL TERRITORY.SUMMARY OF PROJECT ACTIVITIES:PLANNING - THPO WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE DEVELOPMENT, IMPLEMENTATION OF PLANS AND COLLABORATION WITH AGENCIES TOENSURE ONGOING PROTECTION OF CULTURAL RESOURCES WITHIN THE NATION'S ANCESTRAL TERRITORY.SURVEY AND INVENTORY- THPO WILL ADVOCATE AND PARTICIPATE IN SURVEYS OF CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT LOCATIONS.REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE- THPO WILL CONDUCT ROUTINE REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES FOR FEDERAL PROJECTS THATREQUIRE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT (NHPA) SECTION 106 REVIEW AND/OR CONSULTATION, AND PROJECTS WITHINANCESTRAL LAND THAT ARE PRIVATE, COUNTY OR STATE OWNED PROPERTIES AND ARE SUBJECT TO STATE LAWS REGARDINGPROTECTION OF CULTURAL RESOURCES.NATIONAL REGISTER- THPO WILL PARTICIPATE IN EFFORTS TO UPDATE EXISTING NOMINATIONS TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER ANDBEGIN DOCUMENTATION FOR NEW NOMINATIONS TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER.EDUCATIONAL- THPO WILL PARTICIPATE IN EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF THE PROTECTION OFCULTURAL RESOURCES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PLANNING - IMPROVE PROTECTION OF CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH PLANNING EFFORTS ACHIEVED THROUGH PARTICIPATION INMEETINGS/CONSULTATION AND DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING PLANS12 MEETINGS WITH DEL NORTE COUNTY ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW COMMITTEE2 CONSULTATION MEETINGS WITH SIX RIVERS NATIONAL FOREST4 COORDINATION MEETINGS WITH SIX RIVERS NATIONAL FOREST4 MEETINGS WITH LAST CHANCE GRADE CULTURAL RESOURCES WORKING GROUP2 COORDINATION MEETINGS WITH OREGON DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION1 DRAFT HERITAGE IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (SIX RIVERS NATIONAL FOREST) DRAFT NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION PROGRAM PLAN10 TOLOWA DEE-NI' NATION CULTURE COMMITTEE MEETINGSSURVEY AND INVENTORY - CONDUCT SURVEYS OF CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT AREAS WITH POTENTIAL IMPACTS TO CULTURALRESOURCES AND 100% OF ANY NEW LAND ACQUISITIONS BY THE NATION.REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE- ENSURE COMPLIANCE THROUGH REVIEW OF NO LESS THAN 60 PROJECTS.NATIONAL REGISTER- INCREASE THE NATIONAL REGISTER THROUGH UPDATED NOMINATIONS AND IMPLEMENTATION OF DATACOLLECTION FOR ELIGIBLE NOMINATIONS.EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES- INCREASE AWARENESS OF CULTURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF CULTURALLIFEWAYS THROUGH EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES.4 TRIBAL NEWSLETTER ARTICLESWHO WILL BENEFIT FROM YOUR PROJECT:THE TOLOWA DEE-NI' NATION CITIZENS WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT THROUGH THE PROTECTION OF CULTURAL RESOURCES ENSURINGTHE PERPETUATION OF TRADITIONAL LIFE

TO PARTICIPATE IN THE MANDATED PROCEDURES OF THE NATIVE AMERICAN GRAVES PROTECTION AND REPATRIATIONACT (NAGPRA) AS WELL AS ENFORCING SECTIONS 106 AND 101 (D)(2) (36 CFR PART 800). OTHER LAWS FOR THETHPO MAY APPLY UNDER DIFFERENT CIRCUMSTANCES. THESE LAWS INCLUDE: NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT(NHPA), ANTIQUITIES ACT OF 1906, ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESOURCES PROTECTION ACT OF 1979 (ARPA), AMERICANINDIAN RELIGIOUS FREEDOM ACT OF 1978 (AIRFA), NATIONAL MUSEUM OF THE AMERICAN INDIAN ACT OF 1989.THE OVERARCHING MISSION OF THE THPO IS TO HELP MEET THE CULTURAL PRESERVATION NEEDS FOR THE MEMBERS OF THEYANKTON SIOUX TRIBE.1. THE IDENTIFICATION AND REPATRIATION OF OBJECTS SACRED TO THE YANKTON SIOUX RESERVATION2. THE REPATRIATION AND REBURIAL OF ANCESTRAL REMAINS3. THE PROTECTION OF CONTEMPORARY AND ANCESTRAL BURIALS4. "PROTECTION OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES"5. SITE NOMINATION TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES6. ASSESS AND RESOLVE ADVERSE EFFECTSPURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THE THPO IS TO PROTECT, MAINTAIN, AND REVITALIZE THE CULTURE, TRADITIONS AND HISTORY OF THEIHANKTONWAN OYATE.THE THPO HAS THE RESPONSIBILITIES TO ENSURE THE IDENTIFICATION, PROTECTION, AND PRESERVATION OFARCHAEOLOGICAL AND HISTORIC SITES WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE YANKTON SIOUX RESERVATION AND ON LANDSTHROUGHOUT OUR TRADITIONAL TERRITORIES AND ABORIGINAL HOMELANDS.HISTORYTHE YANKTON SIOUX TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO) WAS ESTABLISHED ON OCTOBER 1, 2009. THEYANKTON SIOUX TRIBE IS KNOWN AS THE IHANKTONWAN OYATE (END VILLAGE NATION).

THE THPO WILL CONDUCT ROUTINE COMPLIANCE REVIEW OF UNDERTAKINGS SUBJECT TO SECTION 106 OF THE NHPA. CONDUCTSURVEY AND INVENTORY ACTIVITIES. CONDUCT NATIONAL REGISTER ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENTS AND FACILITATE MEETINGS ANDOPERATIONS OF THE CULTURAL REVIEW BOARD.

"PRESERVING OUR HISTORY TOGETHER"FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P22AS00642THE SUSANVILLE INDIAN RANCHERIA INCLUDES 1857 ACRES OF TRIBAL TRUST LANDS WITH TWO NEW AREAS TO SURVEY THAT ARE59 ACRES.OVERALL GOAL: TO ENSURE THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF THE SACRED SITES, TRADITIONAL CEREMONIAL SITES, ANDHUNTING AND GATHERING SITES AND LANDSCAPES WHERE OUR ANCESTORS THRIVED, LIVED, WORKED, AND GREW.GOAL: TO MONITOR EXISTING 64 HERITAGE SITES ON EXISTING TRUST LANDS AND COMPLETE THE SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF TWONEWLY ACQUIRED TRUST AREAS AND INCLUDE THESE NEW SITES IN THE 5 - YEAR HERITAGE SITE PLAN.OBJECTIVE 1: TO VISIT AND MONITOR EXISTING 64 HERITAGE SITES BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD WITH AT LEAST TWOVISITS WITH YOUTH AND ELDERS AND TROUBLE SHOOT ANY PROBLEMS ENCOUNTERED THROUGH CONSULTATION WITH CULTURALCOMMITTEEOBJECTIVE 2: TO SURVEY AND INVENTORY NEWLY ACQUIRED TRUST LANDS TO ENSURE THAT ANY EXISTING HERITAGE SITELOCATIONS ARE PROTECTED WITH ANY NEW USE ACTIVITY.OBJECTIVE 3: TO SURVEY AND INVENTORY ABORIGINAL LANDS BURNED IN LAST SUMMER'S DIXIE FIRE FOR CULTURAL RESOURCESAND CONSULT WITH OTHER TRIBAL ARCHAEOLOGISTS AND OUR CULTURAL COMMITTEE TO DETERMINE HOW BEST TO SAFEGUARD THESEHERITAGE SITES.PROJECT ACTIVITIESTHE GOAL AND OBJECTIVES FOR THPO 22 WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: MONITORING EXISTINGHERITAGE SITES AND DESIGNATING THE DAYS IN WHICH TO CONTRACT WITH ARCHAEOLOGIST TO SURVEY AND INVENTORY SITES ONNEWLY ACQUIRED TRUST LANDS; OVERSEEING CULTURAL MONITORS ON ABORIGINAL LANDS BURNED IN THE DIXIE FIRE TO PROTECTIMPORTANT RESOURCES THAT WERE EXPOSED AND POSSIBLY HARMED FROM THE FIRE; UTILIZING OUR CULTURAL COMMITTEE ANDTHEIR KNOWLEDGE TO MAKE DECISIONS ABOUT CULTURAL PROTECTION, CREATING SEVERAL FIELD TRIP OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTHTO TRAVEL TO POTENTIAL HERITAGE SITES TO LEARN FROM THE THPO ABOUT THE CULTURAL RESOURCE AND THEIR IMPORTANCE TOTHE CONTINUATION OF THE CULTURE AND FINALLY, FOSTERING THE PROTECTION OF HISTORY THROUGH WORKING WITH THE YOUTHAND HELPING THEM MAKE IMPORTANT CONNECTIONS TO THE ELDERS AND THOSE WHO KNOW THE HISTORY.OBJECTIVE 1: PERFORMANCE GOALS- DECREASES THE LIKELIHOOD OF DESECRATION- FOSTERS CULTURAL AWARENESS IN THE YOUTH WHO ARE OUR NEXT GENERATION OF TRIBAL LEADERS- BRINGS THE ELDERS TOGETHER WITH THE YOUTHOBJECTIVE 1: MILESTONE AND OUTCOMESTHIS WORK WILL BE COMPLETED BY 9/30/2023 WITH THESE OUTCOMES:- 64 HERITAGE SITES WILL BE MONITORED AND REMEDIED (IF NEEDED) FOR FURTHER PROTECTIONS- A CULTURAL COMMITTEE OF 8 PEOPLE WILL ADVISE- 12 YOUTH WILL HAVE PARTICIPATED IN FIELD TRIP TO CULTURAL SITE. OBJECTIVE 2: PERFORMANCE GOALS- GUIDES OUR LAND USE DECISIONS- ENSURES THE CONTINUATION OF OUR CULTURE- MAKES US GOOD STEWARDS OF OUR HISTORYOBJECTIVE 2: MILESTONE AND OUTCOMESTHIS WORK WILL BE COMPLETED BY 9/30/2023 WITH THESE OUTCOMES:- AN UNDETERMINED NUMBER OF NEW SITES WILL HAVE BEEN ADDED TO THE HERITAGE PLAN- A CULTURAL COMMITTEE OF 8 PEOPLE WILL ADVISE- 12 YOUTH WILL HAVE PARTICIPATED IN FIELD TRIP TO CULTURAL SITEOBJECTIVE 3: PERFORMANCE GOALS- PROTECTS THE EXPOSED RESOURCES FROM DESECRATION AND THEFT- TRIBAL MEMBERS GAIN IMPORTANT MONITORING SKILLS- WE LEARN FROM THESE CULTURAL SITES ABOUT OUR HISTORYOBJECTIVE 3: MILESTONES AND OUTCOMESTHIS WORK WILL BE COMPLETED BY 9/30/2023 WITH THESE OUTCOMES:- 5 TRIBAL MONITORS GROW IN EXPERIENCE- A CULTURAL COMMITTEE OF 8 PEOPLE WILL ADVISE

IN ORDER TO BENEFIT FOREST COUNTY POTAWATOMI COMMUNITY (FCPC OR TRIBE) MEMBERS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC, FCPC WILLUTILIZE CULTURAL RESOURCES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT ITS GOAL OF PRESERVING THE TRIBE'S HISTORIC ANDCULTURAL RESOURCES. THIS EFFORT WILL BE GUIDED BY CONDUCTING THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES AND ACTIVITIES BY THE ENDOF THE PROJECT PERIOD:OBJECTIVE 1: DEVELOP SUSTAINABLE PROGRAM FUNDING TO SUPPORT HISTORIC PRESERVATION EFFORTS.ACTIVITY - SECURE AND REPORT ON A PL-638 CONTRACT WITH BIA FOR FORESTRY SURVEY PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT AND PROVIDEFUNDING FOR TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO) GOALS.OBJECTIVE 2: DEVELOP HISTORIC PRESERVATION PLANS THAT ARE COORDINATED, PARALLEL, AND INTEGRATED WITHENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW PROCESSESACTIVITIES - INTEGRATE MANAGEMENT OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES; COMPILE INFORMATION RELATED TO CULTURALRESOURCES SIGNIFICANT TO THE TRIBE; DEVELOP A HISTORIC PRESERVATION PLAN; AND DEVELOP A TRIBAL REGISTER OFHISTORIC PLACES.OBJECTIVE 3: INCREASE THE IDENTIFICATION OF CULTURAL AND HISTORIC PLACES, PROPERTIES AND SITES FOR USE INPLANNING, EDUCATION, PRESERVATION, AND PROTECTIONACTIVITIES - DEVELOP AND ADOPT APPROPRIATE POLICIES; IDENTIFY AND DOCUMENT CULTURAL RESOURCE INVENTORIES; ANDDEVELOP A GIS INTERFACE WITH ANALYSIS AND IDENTIFICATION OF PROPERTIES AND SITES.OBJECTIVE 4: PRESERVE AND PROTECT CULTURAL RESOURCES BY ADMINISTRATING AND PROMOTING AN EFFECTIVE TRIBAL HISTORICPRESERVATION PROGRAMACTIVITIES - GIVE PRIORITY TO REVIEW PROJECTS; WORK WITH FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES TO PROMOTE UNDERSTANDING ANDSUPPORT OF HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROCESSES AND REGULATIONS; ESTABLISH OR EXPAND OTHER AGENCIES INVOLVED INHISTORIC PRESERVATION.

THE FY2022 HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND GRANT WILL BE USED TO FUND THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE OF THE PAWNEENATION AND ITS ACTIVITIES. THIS THPO GRANT WILL BE USED TO MAINTAIN THE CURRENT DAILY WORKLOAD OF THE OFFICE,THE CURRENT CULTURAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL DATABASES, TO UPDATE AND MAINTAIN RECORDS WITHIN THE OFFICE, TO FURTHERRESEARCH THE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE AND ITS RELATIONSHIP TO PREVIOUSLY DOCUMENT SITES. THE GRANT WILL ALSO FUND THETIME AND EXPERTISE REQUIRED TO CORROBORATE PAWNEE ORAL HISTORIES WITH SITES ON THE PAWNEE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE ANDTO ADD TO A GROWING LIST OF 20TH CENTURY CULTURAL SITES.THE SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF HISTORIC, ARCHAEOLOGICAL, SACRED, AND OTHER CULTURAL PROPERTIES OF THE PAWNEE NATIONWILL CONTINUE. THIS SURVEY WILL CONTINUE TO BE AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE SECTION 106 REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE PROCESSFOR STATE, FEDERAL, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES AS WELL AS ANY CORPORATE PROJECT INVOLVING FEDERAL MONIES.ACTIVITIES IMPACTING OR POTENTIALLY IMPACTING NATIONAL REGISTER PROPERTIES ON PAWNEE NATION LANDS WILL CONTINUETO BE MONITORED.THERE ARE NO MAJOR PROJECTS OR ACTIVITIES PLANNED FOR THIS FY2022 GRANT. AS WELL, THERE ARE NO TAX CREDITACTIVES PLANNED NOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT CERTIFICATION ACTIVITIES.WHENEVER POSSIBLE THE PAWNEE NATION THPO WILL PROVIDE COMMUNITY PRESENTATIONS CONCERNING THE PAWNEE NATION'SCULTURAL AND HISTORIC LANDSCAPE AND WILL INTRODUCE PAWNEE ETHNOBOTANY TO THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY.THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE COMPLETED UNDER THIS GRANT AGREEMENT AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TRIBE'S MOA PARTNERSHIPAGREEMENT WITH NPS (UNDER WHICH THE TRIBE ASSUMED THE DUTIES OF THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE AND ISELIGIBLE TO APPLY FOR HPF GRANT FUNDS)

GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF YOUR PROPOSED PROJECT:THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) TRIBAL PRESERVATION PROGRAM GRANT ENABLES THE CHEROKEE NATION (CN)TO PARTICIPATE IN THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROGRAM WHERE THE PRIMARY GOAL IS TO SURVEY,DOCUMENT, AND RECORD HISTORIC PROPERTIES FOR THE PURPOSES OF GUIDING PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES AT THETRIBAL LEVEL. AS A RESULT, THE CHEROKEE NATION TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (CNTHPO) IS ABLE TO MEET OUR GOAL OF ENGAGING IN GOVERNMENT?TO?GOVERNMENT CONSULTATIONUNDER THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT (NHPA). THESE GOALS ALSO ASSIST THE CN THPO INMEETING THE BELOW OBJECTIVES:- IDENTIFY AND NOMINATE ELIGIBLE PROPERTIES TO THE CHEROKEE NATIONAL ANDNATIONAL REGISTERS OF HISTORIC PLACES;- ADMINISTER THE TRIBAL PROGRAM OF FEDERAL ASSISTANCE FOR HISTORIC PRESERVATION WITHINCN;- COOPERATE WITH THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, THE ADVISORY COUNCIL OF HISTORICPLACES, AND OTHER AGENCIES TO ENSURE THAT HISTORIC PROPERTIES ARE TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION AT ALLLEVELS OF PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT; AND- ADVISE AND ASSIST, AS APPROPRIATE, FEDERAL, TRIBAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS INCARRYING OUT HISTORIC PRESERVATION RESPONSIBILITIES.AS A RESULT, THE CN THPO CAN MAINTAIN OUR MISSION OF PRESERVING AND PROTECTING SITES THAT ARECULTURALLY AND HISTORICALLY SIGNIFICANT TO CHEROKEES. IN MEETING THESE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, THEANNUAL AWARD ALLOWS THE CN THPO TO CARRY OUT RESPONSIBILITIES OUTLINED IN AN APPROVED AGREEMENTWITH THE NPS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT ACTIVITIES:THE CN THPO'S PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL SUPPORT CULTURAL PRESERVATION EFFORTS UNDER THE NHPA BYENGAGING IN GOVERNMENT?TO?GOVERNMENT CONSULTATION AND MAINTAINING OUR RESPONSIBILITY INTHE IDENTIFICATION, PROTECTION, AND PRESERVATION OF CULTURAL AND HISTORIC SITES SIGNIFICANT TOCHEROKEES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CN THPO GOALS ARE TIED DIRECTLYTO THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OUTLINED IN OUR APPROVED AGREEMENT WITH NPS.- ADD CHEROKEE SITES OF CULTURAL AND HISTORIC SIGNIFICANCE TO CONFIDENTIAL INTERNALDATABASE,- SUPPORT NOMINATIONS OF CHEROKEE SITES TO TRIBAL AND NATIONAL REGISTERS OF HISTORICPLACES,- PROVIDE ANNUAL WRITTEN REPORT REFLECTING MET GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, INCLUDING TOTALNUMBER AND RANGE OF GOVERNMENT?TO?GOVERNMENT CONSULTATIONS.WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM YOUR PROJECT: THE CN THPO MISSION IS TO PRESERVE CHEROKEE CULTURAL HERITAGEAND PROTECT OUR SACRED PLACES. CHEROKEES DIRECTLY BENEFIT FROM THIS MISSION BECAUSE OUR SACREDPLACES ARE CONNECTED TO OUR CULTURAL IDENTITY. FURTHER, PROTECTING THESE SITES CONTRIBUTESTO OUR OVERALL SHAREDAMERICAN HISTORY.

THE GOAL OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES OF YSLETA DEL SUR PUEBLO FOR FISCALYEAR 2022. COEUR D'ALENE TRIBE THPOFFICE WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE NHPA COMPLIANCE PER THE ESTABLISHED AND APPROVED AGREEMENTWITH NPS.IN FY 2022 THE THPO AND DTHPO (DEPUTY TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE) WILL CONSULT ON FEDERALLY FUNDED,PERMITTED OR OTHERWISE FEDERALLY INVOLVED PROJECTS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH SECTION 106 OF THE NHPA WITHIN THEEXTERIOR BOUNDARIES OF THE RESERVATION AND WITHIN THE TRADITIONAL TERRITORY. THE BULK OF THESE ISSUES WILLLIKELY COME FROM USFS POST-FIRE ACTIONS, WILDFIRE FIGHTING NEEDS, AND ROADS/BRIDGE/INFRASTRUCTURE WORK FROM THESTATE AND FEDERAL HIGHWAY PROGRAMS. HISTORIC, DOCUMENT, ETHNOGRAPHIC, AND OTHER RESEARCH WILL BE CONDUCTED TOINFORM THE COMMENTS, ADVICE, AND (NON)CONCURRENCE CONSULTATION COMPONENTS.PLANNING ACTIVITIES FOR FY2022 WILL FOCUS ON USFS LONG TERM PLANNING FOR RECREATIONAL USE OF LANDS ON RESERVATIONAND IN THE TRADITIONAL TERRITORY TO MINIMIZE/AVOID IMPACTS TO CULTURAL RESOURCES AND EFFORTS TOWARD A POSSIBLE"NO EFFECTS" PROGRAMMATIC AGREEMENT FOR THE REGION'S FORESTS. REVIEW AND REVISION OF AGREEMENTS/SETTLEMENTS ONA FERC LICENSED HYDROPOWER DAM ARE PLANNED. THE RESERVOIR FOR THE DAM IN QUESTION AFFECTS OVER 284 MILES OF BEDAND BANKS ALONG 5 LAKES AND MULTIPLE RIVERS. THERE ARE MULTIPLE RESTORATION, MANAGEMENT AND MAINTENANCEACTIVITIES WITH THE POTENTIAL TO AFFECT CULTURAL RESOURCES.WHILE FEW ARTIFACTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE ACCESSIONED INTO THE TRIBE'S FEDERALLY CERTIFIED ARCHIVAL FACILITY INFY2022, A CONCERTED EFFORT IS PLANNED TO DIGITIZE HARD COPY CULTURAL RESOURCE REPORTS, ORGANIZE AND CATALOG OTHERDOCUMENTS, MAPS AND PHOTOS, AND TO STORE ALL OF THE DIGITIZED COPIES AND CATALOGS ON THE SECURE CULTURAL RESOURCESERVERS THAT ARE ROUTINELY BACKED UP.THE THPOFFICE PLANS TO SURVEY AND INVENTORY 3 ACRES DURING FY2022 USING THIS EFFORT TO ALSO TRAIN COMMUNITYMEMBERS ON CULTURAL RESOURCE METHODOLOGIES.EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES PLANNED FOR FY2022 INCLUDE VISITS TO CLASSROOMS AND SUMMER CAMPS WITH ATRAVELING BOX OF ARTIFACTS AND OTHER MATERIALS TO TEACH ABOUT THE PAST AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. THE THPOFFICEWILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE CULTURAL RESOURCE AWARENESS TRAINING TO CONTRACTORS, AGENCY STAFF AND TRIBE STAFF. THISTRAINING HELPS ENSURE THAT INADVERTENT ENCOUNTERS WITH HISTORIC AND PREHISTORIC MATERIALS ARE NOTICED BY THOSEWITH THE "BOOTS ON THE GROUND." VISITS TO SCHOOLS AND CAMPS INCLUDE EDUCATION ON THE HISTORY OF THE TRIBE IN THEAREA AND THE ONGOING CONCERNS.THE THPO AND DTHPO PLAN TO ATTEND TERRA 2022 EARTHEN ARCHITECTURAL HERITAGE CONFERENCE TO GAIN EDUCATION ANDEXPERIENCE AND NETWORK WITH EXPERTS IN THE FIELD OF EARTHEN ARCHITECTURE. THE TRIBE OWNS THE OLD MISSION ATCATALDO, A NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK. THE MISSION IS AN ENTIRELY UNIQUE STRUCTURE DESIGNED BY JESUIT PRIESTS INTHE CLASSIC EUROPEAN STYLE, CONSTRUCTED OF LOCAL MATERIALS BY COEUR D'ALENE TRIBE MEMBERS. IT IS ESSENTIALLY ATIMBER FRAME WITH BASKETRY INFILL COVERED WITH CLAY. A COMBINATION OF WATTLE-AND-DAUB, ADOBE AND TWINEDBASKETRY. MANAGING SUCH A UNIQUE STRUCTURE IS AN ONGOING CHALLENGE AND RELEVANT TRAINING IS HARD TO COME BY.BOTH THE THPO AND DTHPO MAINTAIN FULL HAZWOPER CERTIFICATION IN ORDER TO WORK IN THE COEUR D'ALENE RIVER BASIN, ASUPERFUND CLEAN UP SITE CONTAMINATED WITH HEAVY METALS FROM MINE TAILINGS. THEY WILL COMPLETE THE ANNUAL 8 HOURREFRESHER COURSE IN FY2022.THIS PROJECT BENEFITS THE ENTIRE RESERVATION COMMUNITY AND ALL THOSE IN THE COEUR D'ALENE TRIBE TRADITIONALTERRITORY BY ENSURING THE BEST PROTECTION FOR HISTORIC PROPERTIES POSSIBLE UNDER NHPA AND PROVIDES EDUCATION AND EDTOUTREACH THAT EXTENDS EVEN BEYOND THIS REGION PARTICULARLY FOR THOSE VISITING THE OLD MISSION AT CATALDO.

THIS GRANT IS SOLELY USED FOR THE OPERATING SUPPORT OF THE CATAWBA INDIAN NATION'S TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATIONOFFICE IT PAYS FOR A PERCENTAGE OF THE DIRECTOR'S SALARY AND OF THE THPO ASSISTANT'S STAFF MEMBER'S SALARY. THETHPO OF THE CATAWBA INDIAN NATION IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ASSUMING FUNCTIONS OF THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICEON TRIBAL LANDS. WE ALSO REVIEW FEDERAL UNDERTAKINGS ON THE MANAGEMENT OF TRIBAL HISTORIC PROPERTIES TO ENSURETHAT OUR TRIBE'S CULTURAL HERITAGE AND PRESERVATION PROGRAMS ARE PRESERVED. LAST YEAR, WE RESEARCHED ANDREVIEWED CLOSE TO 5,000 SECTION 106 PROJECTS AND PARTICIPATED IN NUMEROUS FEDERAL AGENCY CONSULTATIONS. WEREVIEWED SECTION 106 PROJECTS ON OUR RESERVATION, DID HISTORIC RESEARCH ON THE FLORA FOUND ALONG OUR TRIBE'SHISTORICAL WAGON WHEEL TRAIL. WE UPDATED OUR TRIBE'S FLORA AND FAUNA LIST OF EXISTING AND THREATENED ORENDANGERED FLORA AND FAUNA. WE GATHERED HISTORICAL INFORMATION ABOUT OUR HISTORIC CEMETERY, TRAIL AND OTHERSIGNIFICANT SITES. WE HAVE ALSO BEEN COLLECTING INFORMATION FOR A NOMINATION OF OUR CEMETERY TO THE NATIONALREGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES. WE COMPILED ALL OF OUR PRESENT ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES INTO A DATA BASE AND WILL BEWORKING TOWARDS DIGITIZATION OF THEM. DESPITE COVID, WE HAVE BEEN ABLE TO OFFER HISTORIC EDUCATIONAL CLASSES TOVARIOUS GROUPS. THESE ARE JUST A FEW OF THE RESPONSIBILITIES THAT OUR THPO IS INVOLVED WITH.

1. MAINTAIN TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER WITHIN THE CULTURAL PRESERVATION DEPARTMENT.2. CONDUCT TRIBAL LANDS SURVEY OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES/CULTURAL SITES AND MAINTAININVENTORIES.3. NOMINATE ELIGIBLE PROPERTIES TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER.4. DRAFT AND IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE HISTORIC PRESERVATION PLAN.5. CONSULT AND CO-MANAGE HISTORIC PROPERTIES WITH STATE AGENCIES, LOCAL AND FEDERALGOVERNMENTS.6. EDUCATE AND PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION.7. MAINTAIN A CONSISTENT TRIBAL PRESENCE IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION ISSUES WITHIN TRIBALTERRITORY.TRACKING

THE TOHONO O'ODHAM TRIBAL HISTORICAL PRESERVATION OFFICE(THPO)DEALS WITH SECTION 106 COMPLIANCE ON THE LANDS OFTHE TOHONO O'ODHAM NATION (2,700,000 ACRES) AND ON THE TRADITIONAL-USE LANDS OF THE TOHONO O'ODHAM NATION THATSTRETCH FROM YUMA, ARIZONA TO GILA BEND, ARIZONA, TO THE NEW MEXICO BORDER AND SOUTH TO THE BORDER BETWEENARIZONA AND SONORA, MEXICO.THE THPO RECEIVES APPROXIMATELY 50-100 SECTION 106 CONSULTATIONS EVERY WEEK FROM FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCALGOVERNMENT AGENCIES FOR LARGE AND SMALL PROJECTS. THE THPO MAKES A STRONG EFFORT TO RESPOND TO ALL OF THESECONSULTATION REQUESTS IN AN EXPEDITIOUS MANNER. MANY CONSULTATIONS CAN BE RESPONDED TO IN THE MATTER OF A FEWDAYS. IN SOME CASES DEPENDING ON THE SIZE AND COMPLEXITY OF THE PROJECT, CONSULTATION MAY EXTEND FOR MONTHS ANDEVEN YEARS.THE THPO ALSO RESPONDS TO NATIVE AMERICAN GRAVES AND REPATRIATION (NAGPRA) REQUESTS FROM VARIOUS MUSEUMS ANDUNIVERSITIES AROUND THE UNITED STATES.THE THPO ALSO ASSISTS LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN PROSECUTIONS UNDER THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESOURCES PROTECTION ACT.THE THPO ALSO CONDUCTS SECTION 106 AND CULTURAL SENSITIVITY TRAINING SESSIONS FOR VARIOUS LAW ENFORCEMENTAGENCIES AND TRIBAL OFFICE STAFF.THE THPO ALSO CONDUCTS ARCHAEOLOGICAL SURVEYS FOR VARIOUS GROUND DISTURBING ACTIVITIES IN THE LANDS OF THE TOHONOO'ODHAM NATION AND PREPARES REPORTS ON THESE SURVEYS.THE THPO ALSO WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE ARIZONA SHPO,OTHER ARIZONA STATE AGENCIES, COUNTY GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, ANDLOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES IN TUCSON, PHOENIX AND SMALLER COMMUNITIES IN ARIZONA ON VARIOUS HISTORIC PRESERVATIONISSUES.THE THPO ALSO TAKES THE LEAD IN CONDUCTING TRAINING FOR CULTURAL RESOURCE MONITORS WHO WORK ON GROUND DISTURBINGPROJECTS ON THE LANDS OF THE TOHONO O'ODHAM NATION AND ON ADJACENT FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT LANDS.THE THPO ALSO MAKES EDUCATIONAL PRESENTATIONS ON HISTORIC PRESERVATION ISSUE TO MEMBERS OF TRIBAL GOVERNMENT ANDTRIBAL SCHOOLS FROM GRADE SCHOOLS TO TRIBAL COLLEGE CLASSES.

THE TRIBE'S CULTURAL RESOURCE DEPARTMENT IS STAFFED WITH A CULTURAL RESOURCE DIRECTOR (THE THPO), A CULTURALRESOURCE SPECIALIST/ARCHEOLOGIST, CULTURAL RESOURCE ANALYST, A GIS TECHNICIAN, AND AN IN-HOUSE TRIBAL LEGALDEPARTMENT. IN ADDITION, THE DEPARTMENT HAS TRIBAL MONITORING PROGRAM THAT HAS BEEN IN PLACE FOR NEARLY A DECADE.THIS MONITORING PROGRAM EMPLOYS LOCAL TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO POSSESS THE KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERTISE NEEDED IN ORDER TOIDENTIFY CULTURAL RESOURCES AND ASSIST IN THE DEPARTMENT'S OVERALL PRESERVATION EFFORTS. THE ADMINISTRATION COSTSREQUESTED UNDER THE GRANT WILL GO TOWARDS RECRUITING, MANAGING, TRAINING AND ADMINISTRATING TRIBAL MEMBERSENGAGED IN ALL PLAN RELATED ACTIVITIES, WHICH INCLUDE:PLANNING: ROUTINE PLANNING ACTIVITIES ARE PROJECTED FOR THIS FISCAL YEAR. PLANNING ACTIVITIES ARE CONDUCTED BYTHE ADVISORY BOARD COMPRISED OF THE SOBOBA THPO, TRIBAL EXECUTIVE OFFICER, CULTURAL RESOURCE SPECIALIST, AND ASOBOBA TRIBAL ELDER. ADVISORY REVIEW BOARD WILL THOROUGHLY REVIEW NATIONAL REGISTER CONSIDERATIONS BASED ONCRITERIA AND INTEGRITY OF THE PROPOSED LISTING. THE REVIEW PROCESS FOR ALL CONSIDERED LISTINGS WILL HAVE THEINCLUSION OF ADDITIONAL PROFESSIONAL ADVICE FROM OUR RETAINED CONSULTANTS.THE SBLI THPO AND ADVISORY BOARD WILL CONTINUE TO DIRECT AND CONDUCT PROPERTIES SURVEYS (DISCUSSED BELOW), WITHTHE PURPOSE OF LOCATING AND PRESERVING HISTORIC PROPERTIES IN ADDITION TO GUIDING FUTURE TRIBAL DEVELOPMENT.SURVEY AND INVENTORY: ROUTINE SURVEY AND INVENTORY ACTIVITIES ARE PROJECTED FOR THIS YEAR. THE THPO MAINTAINS ANOFFICIAL INVENTORY OF ALL TRIBAL HISTORIC STRUCTURES AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL SITES. THE DEPARTMENT WILLUTILIZE ITS EXISTING GIS TO RUN QUERIES AND FOCUS ON SPECIFIC AREAS AND RECORDS AND CULTURAL RESOURCES ON TRIBALLANDS. IN ADDITION, WE WILL MAINTAIN OUR ACTIVE LIST OF HISTORIC STRUCTURES LOCATED WITHIN THE TRIBE'S LANDS.ADDITIONAL SURVEYS WHICH RESULT IN LOCATING POTENTIAL HISTORIC PROPERTIES WILL BE INVENTORIED ON AN ONGOINGBASIS.REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE: THE SBLI CULTURAL RESOURCES DEPARTMENT CONSULTS WITH FEDERAL AGENCIES ON A REGULAR BASIS.A LARGE NUMBER OF PROJECTS/UNDERTAKINGS AFFECT THE TRIBE'S CULTURAL AND HISTORIC PROPERTIES MAY FALL OUTSIDE OURTRIBAL LAND BUT WHICH FALL WITHIN OUR ANCESTRAL TERRITORY. AS SUCH, THE TRIBE ENGAGES IN GOVERNMENT-TO-GOVERNMENTCONSULTATION ON A REGULAR BASIS WITH MULTIPLE FEDERAL AGENCIES AND THEREFORE IS EXTREMELY FAMILIAR WITH THESECTION 106 PROCESS. AS THESE CONSULTATIONS HAVE OCCURRED FOR YEARS, THE TRIBE HAS ESTABLISHED EFFECTIVE WORKINGRELATIONSHIPS WITH SEVERAL AGENCIES THAT FACILITATE INFORMAL INFORMATION SHARING. IN MARCH 2011, THE COQUILLE INDIAN TRIBE (CIT) SIGNED AN AGREEMENT WITH NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) TO ASSUMECERTAIN RESPONSIBILITIES PURSUANT TO THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT (NHPA; 54 U.S.C. 300101). THATAGREEMENT ALLOWS CIT TO BE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FUNDING FROM NPS TO SUPPORT THE FUNCTIONS OF A TRIBAL HISTORICPRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO). IN THAT AGREEMENT, CIT ASSUMED CERTAIN AUTHORITIES, RESPONSIBILITIES, AND FUNCTIONSTHAT OTHERWISE RESIDE WITH THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (SHPO) IN ADMINISTERING THE REQUIREMENTS OF THENHPA.THOSE AUTHORITIES, RESPONSIBILITIES, AND FUNCTIONS, AS WELL AS HOW THEY WILL BE PERFORMED BY CIT ARE IDENTIFIEDIN THE THPO PROGRAM PLAN AND IN THE THPO ANNUAL WORK PLAN; BOTH OF WHICH ARE REQUIRED IN THE NPS-CIT AGREEMENT.WITHIN THE OVERALL CIT ORGANIZATIONAL HIERARCHY AND BUDGET SYSTEM, THE THPO IS IDENTIFIED AS A FUNCTION OF THECIT CULTURE, EDUCATION, AND LEARNING SERVICES DEPARTMENT (CELS).THE THPO PROVIDES SPECIALIZED AND TECHNICAL EXPERTISE TO CIT IN THE AREAS OF ARCHAEOLOGICAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCESITE PROTECTION; HISTORICAL RESEARCH AND INTERPRETATION; ARCHIVAL RECORDS AND COLLECTIONS MANAGEMENT; INTERAGENCYAND INTER-TRIBAL RELATIONS; PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH; AND TRADITIONAL CULTURAL KNOWLEDGE INCLUDINGARTS, TECHNOLOGIES, LANGUAGE, AND ETHNOBOTANY

THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THE DRY CREEK RANCHERIA THPO PROPOSAL IS FUNDING THE OPERATION OF THE DRY CREEK RANCHERIATRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE. FOR FY 2022, THE DRY CREEK THPO GOALS INCLUDE COMPLETING A CULTURAL SURVEYOF TRIBAL TRUST LAND AND PRODUCING A REPORT; COMPLETING AN ARCHAEOLOGICAL SURVEY ON TRIBAL TRUST LAND; REVIEWINGAND RESPONDING TO SECTION 106 REQUESTS AND ARRANGING CULTURAL MONITORING AS NEEDED; CREATION OF A TRIBAL HISTORICREGISTER; MAINTENANCE OF TWO CULTURAL SITES ON THE RANCHERIA; THPO PLANNING.THE BENEFICIARY OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE ALL MEMBERS OF THE DRY CREEK RANCHERIA BAND OF POMO INDIANS AND THEIRDESCENDANTS.TRACKING

THE RSIC THPO REVIEWS ANY FEDERAL UNDERTAKINGS (PLANS, PROJECTS, ACTIVITIES, ETC.) FUNDED OR AUTHORIZED BYFEDERAL AGENCY OR RSIC TRIBAL PROGRAMS ACCORDING TO SECTION 106 OF THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT. THERSIC THPO WILL MONITOR HISTORIC PROPERTIES ON TRIBAL LANDS AND ANY OTHER LANDS OF THE RSIC CULTURAL INTERESTAREAS. THE RSIC THPO PROGRAM ASSISTANT/ORAL HISTORIAN WILL COMPILE THE ORAL HISTORY ARCHIVES AND LIBRARY FORCULTURAL ENRICHMENT FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC. THE RSIC THPO'S ADVISORY BOARD, TRI BASINCULTURAL COMMITTEE (TBCC), PARTICIPATES IN THE ACTIVITIES OF THE CULTURAL RESOURCE PROGRAM'S MISSIONS, INCLUDINGTHE DEVELOPMENT OF REQUIRED SECTION 106 REVIEW PROCESSES AND DOCUMENTATION. THE TBCC WILL ADVISE ROLES ON TRIBALCONSULTATION WITH TRIBES, FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AGENCIES, AND ORGANIZATIONS REGARDING PLANNINGAND COMPLIANCE WITH AIRFA, NAGPRA, NHPA, NEPA AND ARPA. THE RSIC THPO WILL FACILITATE A GREAT BASIN NATIVEAMERICAN CULTURAL ARTS AND GATHERING IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE RENO, NEVADA ARTOWN. ARTOWN OF RENO, NEVADA IS AMONTH-LONG SUMMER (JULY) ARTS FESTIVAL, FEATURES HUNDREDS OF EVENTS BY MORE THAN 100 ORGANIZATIONS THAT CELEBRATECULTURAL ARTS THROUGH MUSIC, ARTS, THEATER, HISTORY, FILM AND DANCE. THE RSIC THPO EVENT WILL FOCUS ON CULTURALCRAFTS, HISTORY OF THE RSIC, ARTIST'S DEMONSTRATIONS AND DANCE EXHIBITIONS FOR THE PUBLIC OF RENO AND SPARKS,NEVADA. THIS COLLABORATION OF THE GREAT BASIN NATIVE AMERICAN CULTURAL ARTS & GATHERING WILL BE BASED ON THERSIC TRIBES POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR AND DURING THE COVID19 PANDEMIC.TRACKING

THE SOUTHERN UTE INDIAN TRIBE'S TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO) WAS ESTABLISHED THROUGH THEUNANIMOUS SUPPORT OF TRIBAL COUNCIL WITH THE PASSAGE OF TRIBAL RESOLUTION 2021-053. ON APRIL 13, 2021,THE THPO SUBMITTED THE COMPLETE THPO APPLICATION AND TRIBAL RESOLUTION 2021-053 TO THE NATIONALPARK SERVICE (NPS), WHICH WAS LATER APPROVED ON AUGUST 3, 2021. THE PASSAGE OF RESOLUTION 2021-053FACILITATED THE TRANSITION OF THE NATIVE AMERICAN GRAVES PROTECTION AND REPATRIATION ACT (NAPGRA)OFFICE TO A THPO, WHICH RESULTED IN THE TRIBE'S ASSUMPTION OF THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE STATE HISTORICPRESERVATION OFFICER WITHIN THE EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES OF THE SOUTHERN UTE RESERVATION. THE SOUTHERN UTETHPO WILL REVIEW AND, WHERE NECESSARY, CONSULT ON PROPOSED PROJECTS SUBMITTED BY ALL LEVELS OFGOVERNMENT THROUGHOUT OUR ANCESTRAL TERRITORY, AS DEFINED IN TRIBAL RESOLUTION 00-221, WHICH ALSOINCLUDES COORDINATING AND COLLABORATING WITH TRIBAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO IDENTIFY, DOCUMENT, ANDPROTECT ANCESTRAL SITES AND TRADITIONAL KNOWLEDGE ASSOCIATED WITH THESE PLACES FOR CURRENT AND FUTUREGENERATIONS.THE LONG-TERM TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO) GOAL: TO SUPPORT THE SOVEREIGNTY OF THESOUTHERN UTE INDIAN TRIBE. UPON RECEIVING THE AWARD, THE PLAN IS TO ACCOMPLISH OUR GOAL THROUGH THEFOLLOWING INITIATIVES:1. INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE BY PROVIDING TRAININGOPPORTUNITIES FOR THE CURRENT THPO STAFF; AND2. DEVELOP THE ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEDURES AND POLICIES FOR THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE,SPECIFICALLY DEVELOP THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE IMPLEMENTATION PLAN.BY COMPLETING THE PROJECT INITIATIVES, THE THPO WILL DEVELOP THE INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT THE SOVEREIGNTYOF THE SOUTHERN UTE INDIAN TRIBE.

THE BAD RIVER BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR TRIBE OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS, AS A SOVEREIGN INDIAN NATION, RECOGNIZES THEIMPORTANCE OF PROTECTING THE CULTURE AND HISTORIC RESOURCES OF THE BAND FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS AND ASSUMES THERESPONSIBILITIES OF THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE THROUGH AN AGREEMENT EXECUTED ON NOVEMBER 22, 2004WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR - NATIONAL PARK SERVICE. EDITH LEOSO IS THE APPOINTED TRIBAL HISTORICPRESERVATION OFFICER (THPO) AND IS THE LEAD IN IMPLEMENTING THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION PLAN AND PROGRAM, ASOUTLINED IN THE ENCLOSED WORKPLAN, FOR THE BAD RIVER BAND. SHE WORKS WITH THE BAD RIVER TRIBAL REPATRIATIONCOMMITTEE, DESIGNATED TO ASSUME RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE BAD RIVER TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION REVIEW BOARD,COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE BAND WHO ARE KNOWLEDGEABLE OF THE SOCIAL, TRADITION, AND CULTURAL PRACTICES OF THEBAND. THIS PROGRAM ASSISTS THE BAND IN COMPLYING WITH ALL REQUIREMENTS OF THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACTAS IT RELATES TO THE BAD RIVER TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE, AND BENEFITS ALL TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND THOSEINTERESTED IN A FULL REPRESENTATION OF AMERICAN HISTORY, NOW AND INTO THE FUTURE.

THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER WILL PROTECT AND PRESERVE SACRED SITES, TRADITIONAL LANDSCAPES,CEREMONIAL GROUNDS, BY PRESERVING AND DOCUMENTING TRIBAL HISTORY AND WORKING WITH TRIBAL ELDERS AND THE TRIBALCOMMUNITY. DEVELOP CULTURAL EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, PARTICIPATE IN TRIBAL CONSULTATION UTILIZING SECTION 106 ANDOTHER APPLICABLE STATE, FEDERAL, COUNTY AND LOCAL LAWS THAT MAY APPLY.

THE CHOCTAW NATION OF OKLAHOMA TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (CNO THPO, OR CHOCTAW NATION HISTORICPRESERVATION DEPARTMENT) IS CONTINUING TO IMPLEMENT THE TERMS OF THE MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT (MOA) BETWEEN THECHOCTAW NATION OF OKLAHOMA AND THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE. THEY ARE UTILIZING FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING SYSTEMS TO KEEPTRACK OF DEPARTMENTAL EXPENDITURE APPROVALS; TRACKING AND ARCHIVING CONSULTATION PROJECTS THROUGH LASERFICHE; ANDARCHIVING MONTHLY REPORTS ON DEPARTMENTAL WORK. BY DOING SO, THE CNO THPO ENSURES SOUND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT,ACCOUNTABILITY, AND RECORD-KEEPING. ENABLING THE CNO THPO TO MAKE THE BEST USE OF ITS RESOURCES IN CARRYING OUTITS PRESERVATION PLAN, AND TO DO THE BEST JOB POSSIBLE ON BEHALF OF THE CHOCTAW PEOPLE.THE CNO THPO PRESERVATION PLAN HAS BEEN REVISED TO ENSURE THE CNO'S VISION, MISSION, AND VALUES REGARDINGHISTORIC PRESERVATION ARE ACHIEVED AND CARRIED OUT. THE GOALS INCLUDED IN THE APPLICATION INDICATE PROCEDURES ANDHELP ORIENT THE DAILY ACTIVITIES OF THE DEPARTMENT WITH THE GOALS OF THE CHOCTAW NATION AND THE COMMUNITY'SHISTORICAL PRESERVATION NEEDS.SURVEYING AND INVENTORY IS A VITAL RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CNO THPO. KNOWING THE LOCATION AND NATURE OF CHOCTAWHISTORIC SITES NOT ONLY HELPS THE TRIBE COMPLY WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF NHPA ON CHOCTAW NATION-SPONSOREDPROJECTS, BUT IT REVEALS NEW INFORMATION ABOUT CHOCTAW HISTORY, AND THE HISTORY OF SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA. THISHELPS THE CNO THPO PROTECT KNOWN AND CURRENTLY UNKNOWN CHOCTAW SITES AND PROVIDE BETTER HISTORICAL AND CULTURALEDUCATION FOR CHOCTAW PEOPLE. THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE TAKING GNSS COORDINATES OF HISTORIC SITES; ENTERINGHISTORIC PLACES INTO A DATABASE; DOCUMENTING CHOCTAW PLACE NAMES; CONDUCTING ARCHAEOLOGICAL SURVEYS FOR TRIBALLANDS; USING GROUND PENETRATING RADAR SURVEYS IN ORDER TO REMOTELY SENSE UNDERGROUND FEATURES AND UNMARKEDGRAVES; AND REVIEWING CONTRACT ARCHAEOLOGICAL SURVEYS OF SUBSTANTIAL NEW LAND ACQUISITIONS BY THE CNO.ENSURING THAT ALL ACTIVITIES ARE REVIEWED AND IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND INTERNAL GUIDELINES IS OF THE CNOTHPO'S UP-MOST CONCERN. CONSULTATION ON FEDERAL UNDERTAKINGS WITHIN CHOCTAW NATION'S 9-STATE AREA OF HISTORICINTEREST COULD HELP PROTECT THOUSANDS OF CHOCTAW HISTORIC SITES LOCATED BOTH ON AND OFF OF TRIBAL LANDS AND LEADTO GREATER KNOWLEDGE ABOUT CHOCTAW HISTORY. THIS YEAR THE CNO THPO WILL COMPLETE 2,500 SECTION 106 REVIEWS ANDCONTINUE TO CONSULT, MEET, AND COME TO AGREEMENTS WITH FEDERAL AGENCIES MANAGING CHOCTAW LANDSCAPES.THE CNO'S REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES PROVIDES CHOCTAW NATION WITH PERTINENT INFORMATION FOR CONSULTATIONS WITHFEDERAL AGENCIES UNDER SECTION 106 OF THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT AND PROVIDES ADDITIONALOPPORTUNITIES FOR THE DEPARTMENT TO INTERACT WITH TRIBAL CITIZENS IN THE DOCUMENTATION AND PROTECTION OF CHOCTAWHISTORIC SITES. THE CNO THPO INTENDS TO CONTINUE DOCUMENTING AND ADDING SITES TO THE CNO'S REGISTER OF HISTORICPLACES; AND WORK TO PROVIDE PRESERVATION ASSISTANCE FOR NATIONAL REGISTER SITES ON TRUST LAND LIKE THE OKLAHOMAPRESBYTERIAN COLLEGE, CHOCTAW NATION COUNCIL HOUSE MUSEUM, WHEELOCK ACADEMY AND HISTORIC SITE, AND THE EASTERNOKLAHOMA TUBERCULOSIS SANATORIUM, ETC.THE CNO THPO MAKES PRESERVATION COVENANTS WITH FAMILIES OR OTHER RESPONSIBLE PARTIES TO MAINTAIN CHOCTAWCEMETERIES ONCE THEY HAVE BEEN CLEANED AND RESTORED BY THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION DEPARTMENT. BY DOING SO, THE CNOTHPO WILL HELP ENSURE THAT CHOCTAW FAMILY CEMETERIES ARE PRESERVED FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS, THROUGH THE COMBINEDEFFORTS OF THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT AND LOCAL CARETAKERS.THE CNO THPO ALSO UNDERTAKES A LARGE VARIETY OF ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT BROADER EFFORTS TO HELP THE CHOCTAWCOMMUNITY SELF-EMPOWER TO KEEP TRADITIONAL CULTURE A VIABLE, LIVING ENTITY. THIS INCLUDES MAINTAINING 3 COMMUNITYGARDENS OF HERITAGE CROPS. PUBLISHING MONTHLY ARTICLES ON TRIBAL HISTORY, AND TEACHING TRADITIONAL ARTS CLASSES.

WILLATTEND SECTION 106 GOVERNMENT TO GOVERNMENT CONSULTATION ON BEHALF OF THE WINNEBAGO TRIBE OF NEBRASKA TRIBE.NATIONAL REGISTER: THPO WILL UPDATE ON AN ON-GOING BASIS OUR PLAN THAT INCLUDES THE INVENTORY OF LANDS HELD,DEVELOPMENT OF A REGISTRY OF HISTORIC AND CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT SITES, AND TO PROTECT CULTURALLY SENSITIVEPROPERTIES ON TRIBAL TRUST LANDS. THPO WILL WORK WITH THE APPROPRIATE PERSONNEL TO NOMINATE LOCATIONS TO THENATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES.TRACKING

THE SHAWNEE TRIBE PROPOSES CONTINUED OPERATION AND DEVELOPMENT OF ITS TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE ANDSTAFF TO FULLY EXECUTIVE ALL DUTIES ASSUMED BY THE SHAWNEE TRIBE FROM THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE.THESE INCLUDE:1) DIRECT AND CONDUCT A COMPREHENSIVE TRIBAL TRUST LANDS SURVEY OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES AND MAINTAIN INVENTORIESOF SUCH, IN COOPERATION WITH FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS ANDINDIVIDUALS.2) IDENTIFY AND NOMINATE ELIGIBLE PROPERTIES TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER AND OTHER ADMINISTER APPLICATIONS FORLISTING HISTORIC PROPERTIES ON THE NATIONAL REGISTER.3) PREPARE AND IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE TRIBAL TRUST LANDS HISTORIC PRESERVATION PLAN.4) ADMINISTER THE TRIBAL PROGRAM OF FEDERAL ASSISTANCE FOR HISTORIC PRESERVATION WITHIN THE SHAWNEE TRIBE TRUSTLANDS.5) ADVISE AND ASSIST, AS APPROPRIATE, FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS IN CARRYING OUT THEIRHISTORIC PRESERVATION RESPONSIBILITIES.6) COOPERATE WITH THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, THE ADVISORY COUNCIL ON HISTORIC PRESERVATION, AND OTHER FEDERALAND STATE AGENCIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS TO ENSURE THAT HISTORIC PROPERTIES ARETAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION AT ALL LEVELS OF PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT.7) PROVIDE PUBLIC INFORMATION, EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION.8) CONSULT WITH APPROPRIATE FEDERAL AGENCIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT ON:A) FEDERAL UNDERTAKINGS THAT MAY AFFECT HISTORIC PROPERTIES; ANDB) THE CONTENT AND SUFFICIENCY OF ANY PLANS DEVELOPED TO PROTECT, MANAGE, OR TO REDUCE OR MITIGATE HARM TOSUCH PROPERTIES.THE ACTIVITIES WILL BENEFIT THE SHAWNEE TRIBE, ITS CITIZENS, OTHER TRIBES, AND FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL ENTITIESWITH WHICH THE TRIBE MAY CONSULT AND COLLABORATE.

THE GRATON THPO 2022 PROJECT (FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER P22AS00642) WILL UTILIZE THE FY 2022 GRANT FUNDING FROMTHE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND IN ORDER TO CARRY OUT THE RESPONSIBILITIES ASSUMED IN THEMEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT FULLY EXECUTED IN 2013. THE TRIBE WILL USE THE FUNDS TO CARRY OUT THE FOLLOWING GOALS ANDOBJECTIVES: ONGOING CAPACITY BUILDING FOR A SUSTAINABLE THPO OFFICE WHO CAN PARTICIPATE IN A MEANINGFUL WAY INTHE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROGRAM; PROTECTS CULTURAL RESOURCES FROM ADVERSE IMPACTS; IMPLEMENT THEHISTORIC PRESERVATION PLAN THAT COMPORTS WITH THE PRIORITIES OF THE THPO AND IS BASED ON THE TRIBE'S TRADITIONALAND CULTURAL VALUES; DIRECT AND CONDUCT A SURVEY/INVENTORY IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRIORITIES OF THE TRIBE;CONTINUE UPDATING THE TRIBAL INVENTORY WITH THE LOCATION/CONDITION OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES THAT CAN BE USED DURINGLAND USE PLANNING; PROTECT CULTURAL RESOURCES FROM ADVERSE IMPACTS; PARTICIPATE IN REGULATORY PROCESSES INACCORDANCE WITH THE TRADITIONAL CULTURAL VALUES OF THE TRIBE; PROMOTE RELATIONSHIPS BASED ON MUTUAL RESPECT ANDUNDERSTANDING OF THE TRIBE'S CULTURAL RESOURCES MANAGEMENT PLAN (CRMP); REGULARLY CONSULT WITH THE LOCAL, STATE,AND FEDERAL AGENCIES, TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO PROTECT SACRED SITES ON TRIBAL AND ANCESTRALLANDS; TRACK CONSULTATION SESSIONS VIA A TRIBAL DATABASE SYSTEM. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: CONTINUE UPDATING/BUILDING THE TRIBE'S GIS MAPS WHICH SUPPORT THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE SENSITIVITY MODEL USED TO DETERMINE SITELOCATIONS AND POTENTIAL IMPACTS; CONTINUE DEVELOPING THE CRMP FOR THE TRIBE; MAINTAINING INVENTORIES OF THEPROPERTIES IN THE THPO DATABASE AND UPDATE PREVIOUS PHASE 1 SURVEYS FOR THE RESERVATION; BUILDING THE GISDATABASE WITH ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE FORMS AND STUDIES; CONSULTING WITH AGENCIES ON UNDERTAKINGS THAT MAY AFFECTHISTORIC PROPERTIES AND PLANS TO ADDRESS IMPACTS TO SUCH PROPERTIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REGULATIONS AT 36 CFR800 IMPLEMENTING SECTION 106 OF THE NHPA; ACTIVELY MONITORING REGULATORY CHANGES TO UNDERSTAND AND ADVISE ON THEIMPLEMENTATION OF THE MOST CURRENT VERSIONS OF THE REGULATIONS; PROMOTING ACTIVITIES OF THE THPO BY CONDUCTINGREGULAR MEETINGS AND ATTENDING OTHER TRIBAL COMMUNITY EVENTS AND GATHERINGS; PROVIDING WRITTEN AND ORAL REPORTSON THE ACTIVITIES OF THE THPO TO THE APPROPRIATE DESIGNATED OFFICIAL FOR THE TRIBE FOR INCLUSION IN THE MONTHLYREPORTS TO THE TRIBAL COUNCIL; DESIGNING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT FACILITATE, PROMOTE, AND ENGAGE LOCAL TRIBALCOMMUNITY TO ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION IN THE CRMP AND OTHER HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES. PERFORMANCE GOALS,MILESTONES, AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: AN EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM FOR TRIBAL CITIZENS; COMPLETE THE THPO DATABASEWITH RECENTLY RECEIVED ARCHAEOLOGICAL RECORDS AND REPORTS FROM THE STATE REPOSITORY; AND COMPLETE AND UPDATEPHASE 1 SURVEYS FOR THE TRIBE'S RESERVATION. BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE: TRIBAL GOVERNMENT (TRIBALCOUNCIL, COMMITTEE MEMBERS, AND STAFF); TRIBAL CITIZENS; LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL AGENCIES; AND MEMBERS OF THEPUBLIC.TRACKING

THE CHEHALIS TRIBE PROPOSES TO EXERCISE THE ABOVE RESPONSIBILITIES FOR ALL HISTORIC PROPERTIES ON TRIBAL LANDS.THE TRIBE WILL ASSURE THAT THESE UNDERTAKINGS ARE CONDUCTED IN FULL COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE FEDERAL AND STATELAWS AS WELL AS TRIBAL CODES, REGULATIONS, ORDINANCES, AND TRADITIONAL PRACTICES.THE CHEHALIS TRIBE RECOGNIZES CULTURAL RESOURCES ARE INVALUABLE, IRREPLACEABLE, AND ENDANGERED TRIBAL RESOURCES.THE CHEHALIS TRIBE IS COMMITTED TO THE PROTECTION, PRESERVATION, AND PROMOTION OF THE CULTURAL HERITAGE OF THEORIGINAL PEOPLE OF THE CHEHALIS COMMUNITY. THE TRIBE HAS FOCUS ON CULTURAL EDUCATION, SITE PROTECTION,REPATRIATION AND CREATING A COMPREHENSIVE REPOSITORY FOR ALL MATERIALS WHICH HAVE HISTORIC IMPORTANCE TO THECHEHALIS TRIBE. WITH THE INTENT OF PRESERVING, PROTECTING, AND REVITALIZING TRIBAL CULTURE, LANGUAGE AND HISTORYTHE CHEHALIS TRIBE.THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROGRAM WILL MAINTAIN AN INVENTORY OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES ON TRIBAL LANDS AND IN THEIMMEDIATE CHEHALIS TRIBAL COMMUNITY. THIS INVENTORY WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE ABOVE-MENTIONED DATABASE AND THETRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN INVENTORIES OF SUCH PROPERTIES.THE TRIBE'S HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROGRAM HAS ESTABLISHED A MONITORING PROGRAM. HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROGRAMEMPLOYEES RECEIVE SPECIALIZED TRAINING (SITE MONITORING AND CULTURAL RESOURCE TRAINING) THROUGH ALL AVAILABLEMEANS INCLUDING OTHER TRIBES, AGENCIES, ORGANIZATIONS AS WELL AS ON-GOING ON THE JOB TRAINING.STAFF WILL KEEP A DATABASE OF ANY AND ALL FINDINGS CONCURRENT WITH THE PROGRAM.

HAVING AN APPROVED MOA WITH THE WYOMING STATE PARKS IN SHARED NATURAL RESOURCES IS CRITICAL FOR THE PRESERVATIONOF OUT TRIBE'S ABORIGINAL HOMELANDS. CEREMONIAL HUNTING OF BISON HAS BEEN AHISTORICAL STABLE OF OUR ANCESTOR'S DIET. THE MEAT FROM THE BISON WILL BE GIVEN TO TRIBAL ELDERS THAT ARE INNEED. TRADITIONAL/CULTURAL CEREMONIES, AND TRIBAL GATHERINGS THAT OCCUR ON THE WIND RIVER INDIAN RESERVATION.DEFACEMENT OF OUR SACRED CULTURAL PROPERTIES HAVE INCREASED OVER THE YEARS. WITH THE ASSISTANCE FROM LAWENFORCEMENT GROUPS LIKE THE TRIBAL FISH & GAME, THE ESTHPO CAN BEGIN ADDRESSING THIS ATROCITY THAT HAS BEENOCCURRING ON OUT TRADITIONAL CULTURAL PROPERTIES AND PLACES. THE ESTHP WILL HAVE PRESERVATION LAWS INCORPORATEDIN THE TRIBAL LAW AND ORDER CODE ONCE UPDATE IS INITIATED BY THE INTER-TRIBAL BUSINESS COUNCIL.

THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE PRESERVES HISTORIC PROPERTIES AND CULTURAL TRADITIONS THAT ARE IMPORTANTTO THE PASSAMAQUODDY TRIBE. THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT OF 1966 SERVES AS THE GUIDING PRINCIPAL FORACTIVITIES OF THE THPO. MANY ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE ARCHEOLOGICAL SURVEYS, REVIEW OF STATE & FEDERAL ACTIVITIES,AND COMPREHENSIVE PRESERVATION REPORTS & STUDIES, OUTREACH TO TRIBAL COMMUNITY & PUBLIC, NOMINATIONS TO THENATIONAL & TRIBAL REGISTER, EDUCATION ACTIVITIES AND PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL ON THE HISTORICAL PAST, PRESENTAND FUTURE OF THE TRIBE.TRACKING

FY 2022 HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND - TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICETHE BUENA VISTA RANCHERIA OF ME-WUK INDIANS (BVR) DEVELOPS AND CONDUCTS MULTIPLE PROJECTS TO REPRESENT AND EXPANDTHE INTEGRAL CULTURE OF THE TRIBE. BVR'S NATURAL RESOURCE DEPARTMENT (NRD) AND THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATIONOFFICE (THPO) CONTINUALLY WORK TO MAINTAIN, DEVELOP, AND CREATE SPACES FOR CULTURAL PRACTICE AND TRADITIONALKNOWLEDGE. THESE PROJECTS INCLUDE TRIBAL MUSEUM COLLECTIONS, LANGUAGE PROGRAMS, ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES, TRIBALLIBRARY, UPUSANI CULTURAL CENTER, TRADITIONAL ECOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE, AND REPATRIATION. EACH OF THESE PROJECTS ARELISTED BELOW WITH A SMALL DESCRIPTION OF THE PROJECTS. EACH PROJECT ADVOCATES THE TRIBAL HISTORY AND CULTUREWITHIN THE ANCESTRAL TERRITORY AND SURROUNDING LANDS.

HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND THPO GRANT PROJECT NARRATIVE(A.K.A. ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES LIST OR WORKPLAN)TRIBE: GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITYTHPO NAME: BARNABY V. LEWISFEDERAL FISCAL YEAR: 2022ADMINISTRATION: IN FISCAL YEAR 2009 THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY (GRIC) FORMALLY ASSUMED RESPONSIBILITY FORHISTORIC PRESERVATION DUTIES PURSUANT TO THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT (NHPA). THE FOLLOWING PROVIDESTHE ANTICIPATED SCOPE OF WORK FOR FY 2022.PLANNING: THE GRIC CLOSED TRIBAL GOVERNMENT OFFICES ON MARCH 23, 2020 DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. SINCE THATTIME, AND THROUGH MARCH 14, 2022, THE GRIC-THPO HAS BEEN OPERATING ON A LIMITED BASIS WORKING STAGGERED EMPLOYEESCHEDULES. THE GRIC HAS FORMALLY RETURNED TO FULL-TIME WORK STATUS. THE GRIC-THPO CONTINUES TO OPERATE TO THEBEST OF OUR ABILITIES AND WE WILL CONTINUE OUR PLAN TO COLLABORATE WITH VARIOUS TRIBAL ENTITIES TO AMEND THEGRIC'S LAW AND ORDER CODE WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A GRIC HISTORIC PRESERVATION ORDINANCE FOR THE PROTECTION ANDPRESERVATION OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES AND TRADITIONAL CULTURAL PROPERTIES (TCP).THE GRIC-THPO IN ITS 13TH YEAR WILL CONTINUE WORK TO IDENTIFY, REVISE, AND IMPLEMENT EXISTING OR NEEDEDPROGRAMMATIC AGREEMENTS AND OTHER PROCESSES TO REFLECT ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROCEDURAL CHANGES RESULTING FROM THEASSUMPTION OF NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT RESPONSIBILITIES BY THE GRIC.THE GRIC-THPO HAS PROVIDED THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE WITH A WRITTEN ANNUAL REPORT ON THE TRIBE'S ACCOMPLISHMENTS,WHICH WILL INCLUDE AT A MINIMUM, THE NUMBER OF ADDITIONAL PROPERTIES SURVEYED AND ADDED TO THE TRIBE'S INVENTORY,THE NUMBER OF FEDERAL UNDERTAKINGS REVIEWED PURSUANT TO SECTION 106 OF THE NHPA, AND A DESCRIPTION OF EDUCATIONALACTIVITIES AND PROGRAMS CARRIED OUT.SURVEY AND INVENTORY: THE GRIC-THPO IN COLLABORATION WITH THE GRIC CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM (CRMP) ISCOMPILING INFORMATION AND ASSESSING SITE ELIGIBILITY AS WELL AS THE IDENTIFICATION OF TRADITIONAL CULTURALPROPERTIES IN CONNECTION WITH ON-GOING FEDERAL AND NON-FEDERAL PROJECTS ON THE RESERVATION. COSTS FOR FIELDSURVEY AND INVENTORY WILL BE COVERED BY SPONSORS OR AGENCIES RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SPECIFIC UNDERTAKING, OR BY THEGRIC. REVISION AND EXPANSION OF THE EXISTING ACCESS DATABASE FOR THE GRIC SURVEY WILL INCLUDE PROCEDURES FORUPLOADING REVISIONS AND NEW SITE RECORDS GENERATED BY CRMP TO THE TRIBAL INVENTORY. A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING(MOU) IS UNDER DEVELOPMENT THAT WILL OUTLINE THE ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF CRMP FOR CONTRIBUTING NEWINFORMATION TO THE INVENTORY, UNDER GRIC-THPO OVERSIGHT. A PLAN FOR CREATING A GIS PLATFORM TO ASSIST INCONDUCTING SPATIAL AND RECORDS SEARCHES FOR UNDERTAKINGS WITHIN THE GRIC BOUNDARIES WILL ALSO BE DEVELOPED.REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE: THE GRIC-THPO ANTICIPATES CONSULTING ON BETWEEN 150-200 FEDERAL PROJECTS WITHIN THECOMMUNITY'S BOUNDARIES RELATED TO HOUSING, TRANSPORTATION, RIGHT-OF-WAY, IRRIGATION AND AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENTDURING FY 2022 AS REQUIRED UNDER SECTION 106 OF THE NHPA. THE GRIC-THPO WILL ALSO CONSULT ON BEHALF OF THE TRIBEON AS MANY AS 350 FEDERAL UNDERTAKINGS OFF-RESERVATION. IT ALSO WILL PARTICIPATE IN UP TO 20 NATIVE AMERICANGRAVES PROTECTION AND REPATRIATION ACT RELATED CONSULTATIONS WITH VARIOUS FEDERAL AGENCIES AND MUSEUMSNATIONWIDE. GRIC-THPO WILL CONSULT ON MULTIPLE BURIAL AGREEMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH TWO ARIZONA BURIAL DISCOVERYLAWS. GRIC-THPO ANTICIPATES ATTENDING TO 130 DISCOVERIES OF NAGPRA CULTURAL ITEMS WITHIN COMMUNITY LANDS.NATIONAL REGISTER: THE GRIC-THPO WILL CONTINUE TO PLAN DEVELOPMENT OF A TRIBAL REGISTER THAT IN PART THROUGHCOORDINATION WITH TRIBAL INITIATIVES TO IMPLEMENT A REVISED MASTER LAND-USE PLAN, WHICH WILLINTEGRATE AND CONSIDER CULTURAL RESOURCE NEEDS AND CONCERNS. THE GRIC-THPO WILL BE WORKING WITH LAND DESIGN

FISCAL YEAR 2022 IS THE FOURTH YEAR THAT THE JAMESTOWN S'KLALLAM TRIBE (JST) HAS ASSUMED OFFICIAL THPORESPONSIBILITIES. THE JSTTRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE HAVE FOUR MAIN GOALS: PROMOTE TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY, SERVE THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY,MAINTAIN THETRIBE'S CULTURAL AND HISTORIC COLLECTIONS AT PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS, AND SHARE THE S'KLALLAM STORY. PROJECTACTIVITIES PLANNED FOR FISCALYEAR 2022 THAT WILL HELP TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS INCLUDE: FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF THE S'KLALLAM SITE FILE DATABASE,REVIEW NATIONALREGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES NOMINATION FORMS FOR PREVIOUSLY UNEVALUATED PROPERTIES, REVIEW MAINTENANCE ANDREHABILITATION PLANS FORA NATIONAL REGISTER PROPERTY ON JST RESERVATION LANDS, SURVEY AND INVENTORY APPROXIMATELY 10 ACRES OF TRIBALTRUST AND FEE LANDS,CONSULT WITH FEDERAL AGENCIES REGARDING FEDERAL UNDERTAKINGS, PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH AND CULTURAL RESOURCETRAININGS, ANDASSIST WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF EXHIBITS AND INTERPRETIVE SIGNAGE THAT TELLS THE S'KLALLAM STORY.TRACKING

THE MAIN OBJECTIVE FOR THIS GRANT IS TO IDENTIFY CULTURAL RESOURCES LOCATED WITHIN PROPERTIES THAT ARE OWNED ANDMANAGED BY THE SQUAXIN ISLAND TRIBE. THE SECONDARY OBJECTIVES ARE TO HELP ASSIST SQUAXIN ISLAND TRIBALDEPARTMENTS WITH THE CULTURAL RESOURCE COMPONENT OF THEIR UNDERTAKINGS, REVIEW PROJECTS FROM VARIOUS AGENCIES(FEDERAL, STATE, COUNTY, AND CITY) TO PROTECT SIGNIFICANT CULTURAL RESOURCES, AND RESPOND TO INADVERTENTDISCOVERIES. THESE PROJECTS INVOLVE SURVEYING A TOTAL OF 27.22 ACRES OF LAND, REVIEWING 250 OR MORE UNDERTAKINGSPER FISCAL YEAR, HELPING OTHER SQUAXIN ISLAND TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS COMPLETE THEIR CULTURAL RESOURCE REQUIREMENTSFOR THEIR GRANTS AND PROJECTS, AND BEING DIRECTLY INVOLVED IN INADVERTENT DISCOVERIES. DUE TO CONFIDENTIALCONCERNS, THE PARCEL NUMBER OF PROPERTIES WILL NOT BE PROVIDED IN THIS ABSTRACT. THE PERFORMANCE GOALS ARE TOCOMPLETE A MINIMUM OF THREE CULTURAL RESOURCE SURVEYS WITHIN FISCAL YEAR 2022, REVIEW FEDERAL AND NON-FEDERALPROJECTS AS THEY ARE SENT TO OUR OFFICE FOR REVIEW AND CONSULTATION, AND TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE ABOUTCULTURAL RESOURCES MANAGEMENT TO THE OTHER DEPARTMENTS WITHIN THE SQUAXIN ISLAND TRIBE. THIS BENEFITS THESQUAXIN ISLAND TRIBE AND COMMUNITY.TRACKING

ACTIVITIESINCLUDE ADMINISTRATION THE OF PUEBLO'S PROGRAM, UPGRADING THE THPO FACILITIES AND PROCESSES, PARTICIPATINGMEANINGFULLY IN THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROGRAMS, AND PROTECTING CULTURAL RESOURCES FROM ADVERSEEFFECTS.
