THE ZUNI GOVERNOR CONJOINED THE ZUNI HERITAGE AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION WITH THE ZUNI CULTURAL RESOURCEENTERPRISE IN 2008. CURRENTLY, ZCRE FUNCTIONS AS THE ZUNI THPO. ZUNI THPO GOALS FOR FY2022 ARE: 1. PRESERVE ANDPERPETUATE ZUNI CULTURE AND THE PLACES AND LANDSCAPES THAT ARE ASSOCIATED WITH ZUNI HISTORY AND TRADITIONS IN AMANNER CONGRUENT WITH ZUNI CULTURAL VALUES. 2. PROTECT ZUNI TRADITIONAL CULTURAL PLACES TO SUSTAIN THEIRTRADITIONAL USE. 3. PROTECT AND MANAGE ARCHAEOLOGICAL, HISTORICAL, AND CULTURAL SITES AND OBJECTS ON THE ZUNIINDIAN RESERVATION. TO ATTAIN THESE PRESERVATION GOALS, THE ZUNI THPO WILL STRIVE TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWINGOBJECTIVES: 1. ENACT THE ZUNI HISTORIC PRESERVATION ORDINANCE. 2. REVIEW ALL FEDERALLY AND TRIBALLY FINANCED ANDASSISTED PROGRAMS, ACTIVITIES, AND UNDERTAKINGS ON THE ZUNI INDIAN RESERVATION FOR POTENTIAL IMPACTS ON CULTURALRESOURCES AS MANDATED IN FEDERAL AND TRIBAL COMPLIANCE STATUTES AND REGULATIONS. 3. LOCATE, IDENTIFY, ANDEVALUATE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INCLUDING ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES AND TRADITIONAL CULTURAL PLACES, ON THE ZUNI INDIANRESERVATION. 4. MANAGE AND PROTECT HISTORIC ARCHITECTURE ON THE ZUNI INDIAN RESERVATION. 5. LOCATE AND IDENTIFYZUNI CULTURAL RESOURCES, INCLUDING TRADITIONAL CULTURAL PROPERTIES, LOCATED OFF THE ZUNI INDIAN RESERVATION. 6.REPATRIATE ZUNI CULTURAL ITEMS AS APPROPRIATE. 7. CREATE AND MAINTAIN THE ZUNI REGISTER OF CULTURAL RESOURCES. 8.IN COOPERATION WITH THE NEW MEXICO AND ARIZONA SHPOS, MAINTAIN RECORDS AND A COMPUTERIZED DATABASE OFARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES ON THE ZUNI INDIAN RESERVATION. 9. DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT GUIDELINES TO PROTECT SENSITIVECULTURAL RESOURCE INFORMATION. 10. MAINTAIN THE ZUNI CULTURAL RESOURCE ENTERPRISE OFFICE LIBRARY. 11. PROMOTEAND IMPLEMENT PUBLIC EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO (A) INVOLVE ZUNI PEOPLE IN HISTORIC AND CULTURAL PRESERVATION, (B)PRESENT PRESERVATION ISSUES, GOALS, AND OBJECTIVES TO THE PUBLIC, AND (C) EXPAND AND ENHANCE THE CONNECTIONSBETWEEN ZUNI CULTURAL PRINCIPLES AND CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS. 12. PROVIDE TRAINING, EDUCATION, ANDEMPLOYMENT FOR ZUNI TRIBAL MEMBERS INTERESTED IN CULTURAL RESOURCE DISCIPLINES AND PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES. 13.PROCURE SUITABLE OFFICE FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT NEEDED TO FULFILL GOALS OF THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROGRAM.14.SECURE ADEQUATE AND STABLE FUNDING TO OPERATE THE ZUNI HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROGRAM. THE ZUNI THPO PROGRAM WILLUTILIZE FY 2022 FUNDING FROM THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND (HPF) IN ORDER TO IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES ON ZUNI INDIANRESERVATION LANDS TOWARD ACHIEVING THE ABOVE IDENTIFIED OBJECTIVES. SPECIFIC PROGRAM ACTIVITIES WILL BECONSISTENT WITH THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND MANUAL AND REFLECT THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICERRESPONSIBILITIES (IN ITALICS) AS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 101(B)(3) OF THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT (NHPA)AND ASSUMED BY THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI PURSUANT TO SECTION 101(D)(2) OF THE NHPA.

THE MISSION OF THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE IS TO FOSTER, IMPROVE, AND PROTECT THE CULTURAL HERITAGE OF THETRIBE, ON AND OFF THE RESERVATION, FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS OF THE AGUA CALIENTE PEOPLE. THE HISTORIC PRESERVATIONOFFICE WILL WORK WITH THE TRIBAL MEMBERS, THE TRIBAL COUNCIL, OTHER TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS, PROGRAMS, AND AGENCIES TOMEET ITS MISSION. THE AGUA CALIENTE BAND OF CAHUILLA INDIANS (ACBCI) RECEIVED ITS DESIGNATION FROM NATIONAL PARKSERVICE (NPS) IN 2005 AS A TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO), PURSUANT TO THE NATIONAL HISTORICPRESERVATION ACT (NHPA), AS AMENDED. THE THPO WORKS WITH THE TRIBAL COUNCIL, THE TRIBAL MEMBERSHIP, OTHER TRIBALDEPARTMENTS AND TRIBAL PROGRAMS, AND FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES TO MEET ITS PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDINGSECTION 106 OF THE NHPA, CONSULTATION, MONITORING CONSTRUCTION AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL EXCAVATIONS, PROTECTINGBURIALS, AND MAINTAINING AN ARCHIVAL DATABASE.THE ACBCI TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO) WILL UTILIZE THE THPOP GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPLEMENT THE ACBCITHPO AND FUND CERTAIN RESPONSIBILITIES ASSUMED BY THE TRIBE PURSUANT TO SECTION 101(D)(2) OF THE NHPA. ALL THPOWORK WILL BE GUIDED BY THE AGREEMENT AND THE 'TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ORGANIZATION AND POLICIES', WHICHIDENTIFIES THE SPECIFIC FUNCTIONS, ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE THPO. THE ACBCI THPO PLANS TO UTILIZE NPSFUNDS FOR ROUTINE REVIEW AND COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES, CONTRACTED SERVICES, SUPPLIES, TRAINING AND TRAINING RELATEDTRAVEL, AND SUBSCRIPTIONS/ DUES DURING THE GRANT FUNDING, ANY OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL BE FUNDED BY THE TRIBE.

THIS GRANT SUPPORTS THE OPERATION OF STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICES (SHPO) FOR THE FEDERATED SATES OF MICRONESIA WITHIN ALLOWABLE PROGRAM AREAS DESCRIBED IN THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION FUND GRANTS MANUAL. WHERE RELEVANT, STAFF AND PROJECTS MUST COMPLY WITH THE APPROPRIATE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR'S STANDARDS. THE PURPOSES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE TO PROVIDE MATCHING GRANTS TO STATES FOR THE IDENTIFICATION, EVALUATION, AND PROTECTION OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES BY SUCH MEANS AS: SURVEY, PLANNING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, DEVELOPMENT, FEDERAL TAX INCENTIVES AVAILABLE FOR HISTORIC PROPERTIES, EXPAND THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES, AND TO ASSIST FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND PRIVATE INDIVIDUALS IN CARRYING OUT HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES. AWARDS UNDER THIS PROGRAM MUST COMPLY WITH AND SUPPORT 54 USC 301 ET SEQ. (COMMONLY KNOWN AS THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT).
